My husband plans to buy the necessary materials in bulk required in shoemaking to lower our costs.

loans.use: To expand shoe business

loans.name: Adabus

texts.id:
Adabus sells mineral water in surrounding areas, to meet his living needs expenditure. He carries out this work tirelessly. Mineral water, which he purchased from the water company, is transported to the surrounding areas using his motorcycle to seek customers; the distance covered for this by Adabus is 20 kilometers. His target area includes housing locations in the district of Nusa Dua to the City. This effort is carried out to support the livelihood as well as pay the family’s daily needs expense.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Adabus adalah seorang penjual air mineral keliling, untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup Adabus menjalankan pekerjaannya dengan tak mengenal rasa lelah. Air mineral yang di beli dari perusahaan air dibawanya berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor untuk mencari para pembeli, jarak yang ditempuh oleh Adabus mencapai 20 kilometer. Sasarannya adalah lokasi perumahan yang ada di daerah Nusa Dua sampai ke Kuta. Usaha ini dilakukan untuk menunjang kehidupannya beserta keluarga yang setiapharinya membutuhkan biaya.

loans.use: Capital to purchase mineral water from bottler (Modal untuk membeli air mineral dari pabrik)

loans.name: Mokhy

texts.en: Mokhy A. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2003.. She has recommended herself as a  serious and strongly motivated client. She implements commercial services and trade. She has a business in  child wear selling. Mokhy A. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where her shop is located. She has a large assortment and follows the new models and fashion. Now she requests a loan for business support to import new products and to enlarge her inventory.

loans.use: For business support

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.pt:
Carlos Fernando C. is 34 years old, married, and is the father of 5 children. He lives in the Albasine district near the city of Maputo. He entered the program in February of 2007 with a loan for 6.000MT and from then to now his business has grown reasonably. He has 2 stands in the Xiquelene market to sell used clothing and also refreshments and beer. He is looking for a loan of $825US for 6 months to continue to strengthen his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Carlos Fernando C. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Albasine, arredores da Cidade de Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT e de lá para cá o negócio teve um crescimento razoável.Tem duas bancas no mercado Xiquelene de venda de roupa usada, e ainda, vende refrescos e cerveja. Vai tomar um mepréstimo de 20.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para continuar a fortalecer mais o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Joko

texts.id:
Ever Since the year 2000, Joko S. a fresh fruit vendor started his business selling fresh fruits around Setia Budi and Gunung Agung area. He carries the fruits around in his cart. The fruits he sells varies from Mangoes, Papaya, Grapes, Water Melon and other varieties.

As the breadwinner of the family, Joko worked hard to raise his two young children and try to fulfill their basic needs.

His hope for the future is that he will be able to buy a motorcycle equipped with cart which will allow him to travel further to sell his fruits.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Vincent Liew

Sejak tahun 2000 yang lalu Joko S. berprofesi sebagai Penjual Buah Segar. Setiap hari Joko menjajakan buahnya dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan gerobak yang isisnya berbagai macam buah segar, seperti; Melon, Mangga, Pepaya, Anggur, Semangka, dan lain-lain.

Lokasi yang dipakai Joko untuk berjualan adalah daerah jalan Setia Budi dan Gunung Agung. Usaha ini dilakukannya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya apalagi untuk membesarkan kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil.

Sebagai kepala keluarga Joko berusaha keras dalam pekerjaannya agar bisa memenuhi kebutuhan tersebut. Harapannya adalah memiliki gerobak yang lebih baik yaitu dengan memakai sepeda motor yang bisa menjangkau tempat yang lebih jauh.

loans.use: Expand Business - The loan will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables for re-selling.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: I am Sakina B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  I am married with nine children. My husband operates a shop in the used items market, located near our house. He buys and sells various spare parts of different machines and vehicles. He is in this business for more than three years. My husband hopes to improve his business by adding a complete range of used spare parts. He needs $425 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Bickencha

texts.en: Bickencha T. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004.  She has recommended herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. She engages in  commercial services and trade. She has a business in child wear and shoe selling. Besides this she has a business in head-dress selling. She has been in business for 15 years.  Bickencha T. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where her shop is located. She has a wide assortment. Now she requests a loan  for  business support and to increase her head-dress business.

loans.use: For business support and to increase her head-dress buisiness

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My name is Parveen A.. I am married and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am a mother of three children, the eldest one attends a kindergarten and other two are too young to attend the school at the present. My husband is a scrap dealer. He buys and sells plastic bottles and various items made up of iron. He is looking for a loan of $250 to expand his business so that he can improve our income.

loans.use: To expand scrap business

loans.name: Pahala

texts.id:
Pahala resides in Bali since 1984 and his work is selling carpet in surrounding area. Pahala sells carpet purchased from the carpet factory in surrounding area with a bicycle. He starts this carpet selling activity from 7:30 in the morning until 4 in the evening. Each carpet costing Rp. 40.000 (about USD4) is sold for Rp. 60.000 (about USD6); each day Pahala usually sell 3 to 4 carpets. The profit generated is used to fund purchase of more carpets and also to pay for daily living expenses. Father of 1 child still in middle school, he wants to be able to provide adequate education to be a professional carpet merchant.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Pahala tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1984 dan usaha yang dijalani usaha adalah penjual karpet keliling. Karpet yang di beli dari gudang karpet yang ada di Monang-maning dijual oleh Pahala dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan sepeda onthel. Dia uali menjual karpetnya pada pukul 07.30 pagi sampai jam 4 sore. Satu karpet dibelinya dengan harga 40.000 rupah dan dijual oleh Pahala dengan harga 60.000 rupiah, dalam sehari kadang Pahala bisa menjual 3 sampai 4 karpet. Keutungan yang diperoleh dipergunakan untuk modal untuk membeli karpet dan juga buat biaya hidup setiaphari. Bapak satu anak ini mampu menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih SMP hanya dengan berprofesi sebagai penjual karpet.

loans.use: Capital to purchase carpets (Modal untuk membeli Karpet)

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Tolibjon B. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He is a permanent client of MicroInvest because he trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. He engages in commercial services and trade.  Tolibjon works in the confectionery business, baking and selling fancy cakes . He has a wide assortment but wants to improve the business by delivering new products . He has been in this business for 23 years. Tolibjon B. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where his shop is located. Now he requests a loan  for  business support and to expand his products.

loans.use: For business support and to expand his products.

loans.name: Seman

texts.id:
Seman and his wife, living together, leased a piece land in Denpasar as their residence and support their children toy business. Together they operate this toy business, his wife is tasked with selling the toys from the home while Seman peddle the surrounding areas using a motorcycle with special rack for the toys. With this effort, Seman is able to fulfill the family’s daily expenditure. The profit earned Seman use to fund this business and the balance to cover the living expenses and the lease on which he resides with his wife.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Seman tinggal bersama istrinya dengan mengontrak sebidang tanah di Denpasar untuk tempat tinggalnya serta menunjang usahanya sebagai penjual mainan anak-anak. Bersama sang istri Seman menjual mainan anak-anak, istrinya bertugas menjaga jualan mereka dirumah sedangkan Seman menjajakannya dengan cara berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor yang dibuatkan rak-rak khusus untuk tempat mainan. Dengan usaha seperti ini Seman bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumahtangganya setiap harinya. Keuntungan yang didapat dipakai Seman sebagai modal untuk usahanya dan sebagian lainnya untuk biaya hidup dan membayar kontrakan yang ditempatinya bersama sang istri.

loans.use: Capital to purchase children toys (Modal untuk membeli barang, mainan anak-anak)

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra M. has been selling cookies and other confectionery products for over 7 years.Her business is located in the J.Rasulov region,Tajikistan. She buys her goods from local confectionery workshops in lots. Gulchehra became client of Microinvest in 2003.During her partnership with our organization she has recommended herself as a  punctual and honest client. Her current business is doing well and she already receives orders from her many clients,who came from distant villages. Gulchehra wants to purchase a very large batch of goods and that is why she is applying to the KIVA program to help her financially.

loans.use: Purchase next batch of cookies.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo R. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She works at home in the commercial industry of women's wear. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and our statistics indicator shows that she has had an income increase and business stability. Surayo is a very experienced seamstress and has a lot of clients. In the future she plans to open her own  private company in  women's wear making and selling.  Now she requires a loan  for the  purchase of special material.

loans.use: To purchase special material

loans.name: Saronik

texts.id:
Gathering recyclable materials is Saronik’s zealous occupation. This activity of collecting recyclable materials is from people with returns. The materials are weighed and paid for by Saronik then turned into recyclable and resold to factory. With a leased land of 2.5 acre, Saronik can store plenty recyclable materials obtained. This effort provides acceptable profits to cover living expenses including paying for the lease of the land.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas adalah pekerjaan yang ditekuni oleh Saronik. Usahanya menampung barang-barang bekas yang didapatkan oleh para pemulung. Barang-barang tersebut ditimbang kemudian di bayar oleh Saronik dan nantinya akan diolah untuk dijadikan bahan daur ulang yang kemudian dijual lagi ke pabrik-pabrik. Dengan mengontrak tanah seluas 2,5 are saronik dapat menampung banyak barang bekas yang didapatkan dari para pemulung. Usaha ini menurutnya dapat memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup termasuk biaya untuk mengontrak tanah.

loans.use: Capital to purchase recyclable materials from people with returns (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pemulung)

loans.name: Bukari

texts.id:
Bukari’s profession is a trader in recyclable materials to cover his family’s expenditure. Everyday he starts work at 7 in the morning and return home at 6 in the evening. Bukari purchase recyclable materials like used cardboard boxes, empty bottle, cans, iron, household equipment and others then these are resold to recycle consolidators. Profit generated by Bukari is used to fund this activities the balance to cover their daily living expenses. Besides that Bukari needs to pay the monthly lease for the room costing Rp. 150.000 (about USD16).

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Bukari berprofesi sebagai seorang Penjual barang bekas untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Setiaphari Bukari mulai bekerja pada pukul 07.00 pagi dan kembali lagi kerumah pukul 18.00 atau jam enam sore. Cara kerja Bukari adalah membeli barang-barang bekas seperti; kardus, botol kosong, kaleng, besi, peralatan rumatangga dan lain-lain yang kemudian barang-barang tersebut di jual lagi ke Pengepul barang bekas. Hasil yang didapatkan oleh Bukari digunakan lagi untuk modal usaha selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya bersama istri seiaphari. Selain itu juga Bukari harus membayar kontrakan kamar yang perbulannya harus dibayar dengan harga 150.000 rupiah.

loans.use: Capital for purchasing recyclable materials (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Makhkam

texts.en: Makhkam A. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan.  He has only been a client of Microinvest this year, but already he has recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. He trades in the Kistakuz bazaar where he trades in dried fruits. He has the rather good assortment. Working in this sphere Makhkam has competitors so now he requires a loan  that will allow him to improve the condition of his business and to expand his assortment of products.

loans.use: To expand his assortment of products

loans.name: Faizy

texts.en: Faizy A. lives in Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active, serious, and strongly motivated client of MicroInvest since 2004. Faizy has a business selling  women 's dresses, bedding, and towels. She runs her shop in the Kistakuz bazaar and the Friday bazaar,  which are the largest rural bazaars near her.  She has a loyal clientele because she offers a wide assortment of goods. She is asking for a loan of $1200 to expand her inventory and bring in new models of clothing.

loans.use: To expand inventory in her clothing business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing N. is 34 years old and married, with 4 children.  She hails from Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  She sells yams to people living in her community.  She requests a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar Z. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan.She is married and has 3 children. She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She recommended herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. She engages in commercial services and trade. Munavvar  works in the Kistakuz bazaar where she trades in coffee, chewing gum, sweets and other small things. Now she requests a loan in to expand her assortment of products.

loans.use: To increase her product assortment

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en: Abdurashid T. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2004.  He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. He engages in commercial services and trade. He has a business that sells bedding units and towels. Abdurashid  works in the Kistakuz bazaar. Now he wants to purchase child wear to expand the existing business. He has many permanent clients because he has a wide bedding and towel assortment. Now Abdurashid requests a loan  for  business support, to continue to increase the variety of bedding and towels he sells and to expand his inventory to include children's clothes.

loans.use: For business support

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: I am Fozia N.. I am married and I have been living in Lahore (a big metropolis in Pakistan), since my birth. I am quite good at stitching but I have not chosen it yet as a profession, to earn a living. My husband is a shoemaker; he makes and sells very trendy shoes. He wants to expand his business and produce a higher quantity of shoes. For this purpose he requires a loan of $250. He will buy the required raw materials in bulk and will save on cost per item.

loans.use: To expand shoe business

loans.name: Riski

texts.en: Riski S. is divorced. She has 6 children and two of her sons are already married.Her business is in the trade of children's clothes. She chose  this kind of business because she loves her own children very much.They helped her in difficult situation when her husband divorced her. Her children are the source of her main meaning in her life.Due them she did not lose her presence of mind  and she found the  power to live and thrive.Today Riski is happy because she has 4 grandchildren. Her sons help  her financially.  But she does not want sit at home because her work has  became something that she could not imagine her life without.  Now she is requesting a loan to help repair the roof of her house. She also wants to increase the volume of her goods.

loans.use: Purchase the next batch of goods.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina T. is 46 years old, married and has 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells cooked food.  She has been a LAPO member for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs.  This, she said, will enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.en: Zulaiho K. lives in Khujand.  She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active, serious, and strongly motivated client of MLF MicroInvest since 2005. Her credit record has made her eligible for larger loans.  She runs a street stand where she sells sugar, sodas, salt, sweets, etc.  Working in Panjshanbe bazaar, she  has many competitors, and for this reason she wants to expand the assortment of goods she offers for the New Year. She is asking for a loan of $450 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand the assortment of goods she sells in her grocery stand

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: I am Farzana K.. I am 36, married, and a mother of one son. My husband is a rickshaw driver and I am a seamstress.  I sew very trendy clothes in the latest fashion.  My clients like the clothes very much. I would like to borrow $350 to buy a more modern sewing machine for my business in order to respond promptly to my clients.  The wedding season has just started and I have a great number of orders to fulfill. Thank you.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and few other necessary materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: "Women can not do without making their hair," says Mrs. Justina I., who owns a salon where she braids and fixes hair for people.  She is also into the pedicure and manicure business.  She is 36 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Benin City and requests a loan of $450 to enable her buy to more weave-on, relaxers and hair cream to sell.  She has been in business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more weave-on, relaxer hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Nizam

texts.en: Nizam M. lives and works in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 52 years old and is married with two kids. Nizam is in the transportation business, and he drives a van providing transportation between Khachmaz and the capital city of Baku. Nizam has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit; thus proving to be one of our trusted and valued customers. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can make repairs to the van that he uses for his business.

loans.use: To make improvements/repairs to the van that he uses for his business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Mrs. Christiana P. is 57 years old, married and has 7 children.  She lives in Benin City where she sells plantains, yams and also grinds tomatoes and pepper for people.  She has 10 years of experience in the business.  She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and yams to sell

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat A. started the  trade of alcohol drinks after graduating secondary school in 2003. Before that he worked in a  shop selling  for over 3 years. His salary was 30% of his sales in month.His salary was only one income in his family because his parents were old and could not earn enough money for all the family needs.Today he has his own shop in the  Istaravshan region,Tajikistan.He gets stable profit and his experience has  helped him to attract more new clients. Also his younger  brother helps him at his shop. Shavkat tries teach his brother  all the skills of being an excellent seller which he has learned from experience.From KIVA he is requesting  extra capital to increase the volume of goods before the holiday,as his products will be in high demand.

loans.use: Purchase a large batch of alcohol drinks before holiday.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman T. owns and operates a small stand in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He sells a mixture of items but mainly sells items relating to the Muslim religion. Suleymon has been operating this business for the past nine years and is married with four kids. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can expand and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence B. is 39 years, a widow and has 3 children.  She hails from Benin City where she fixes and braids hair for people.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She is in need of a loan to buy more weaveons, relaxers and hair cream to sell.

loans.use: To buy more weaveons, relaxers and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: I am Farida A. Q. from Lahore, a big metropolis. I am 39, married and have five children. All of my children study at a local school. I am determined to support my husband by sharing his financial burden by stitching clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband is a shoemaker and needs to expand his business. by buying raw materials such as leather, glue and decorative ornaments for his shoemaking business.She urgently needs a loan and is requesting a $500 loan.

loans.use: Expand shoes business

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer T. owns and operates a small footwear stand in the bazaar located in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. (His father is pictured). He is 30 years old and is married with two children. Azer has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Normicro proving that he is a customer who can be trusted. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is 23 years old and has a 3-year-old daughter. She started selling toys after joining MBK. Her husband, Ilal, sells sand and usually earns about US$ 2 per day.  She is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods and expand her business. Siti is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 60 years old.  She is a widow with 9 children.  She hails from Benin City where she sells pap (akamu).  She has been in this business since 1984.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more corn for the preparation of pap (akamu).

loans.use: To buy more corn for preparation of pap (akamu)

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan B. has been selling  rice for 10 years at the central market of Istaravshan region,Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. His wife has her own business. She sells tea by boxes and sacks.Together they  try to earn money for family needs.They want their children to not need for anything. From the beginning Hasan started to buy products for retail sale, as his assets were limited.His partnership in Microinvest helped him to increase his working capital and to buy rice by lots (by the ton). Today Hasan has a good turnover of his goods and he makes purchases himself. From the KIVA program he is requesting a loan to make his next purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in lots.

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en: Mimin is 44 years old and is the mother of a child aged 12. She sells housewares and can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, R., sells vegetables at the market and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Mimin needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her  little business selling housewares

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 22 years old. He lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Mohamad owns a fruit and vegetable store. This is the third time he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 to assist him in purchasing a pickup truck for the transportation of provisions. Mohamad is constantly striving to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport provisions

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Mrs. Philomena K. is 48 years old and a widow.  She lives in Benin City where she sells drinks and fresh fish pepper soup.  She learned this business for six months and started her own in 1990.  She has been a LAPO member for 3 years and needs a loan of $275 to buy ingredients for preparing fresh fish pepper soup.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for preparing fresh fish pepper soup to sell

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri M. is 24 years old and has a 1-year-old child. She sells soap and detergents and can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, Hendra, is a parking man and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Sri Mariani is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 36 year old man. He lives with his wife and three children in South Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Saleh owns a glass store. He needs $1200 to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop his business. Saleh is constantly striving to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 32 year old man.  He lives in South Lebanon in the region of Saida. This is the third time Ashraf is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He usually uses it to buy merchandise for his grocery shop. This time, he will also be using the loan to purchase merchandise.  It is the holiday season and that he will need more provisions for the occasion.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery shop

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 22 years old and is the mother of a child aged 1. She sells clothes and sandals on credit and usually earns about US$ 10 per day. Her husband, A., is a motorcycle driver and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Hilda is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Carolina Alfredo

texts.pt:
Carolina Aflredo B. M. is 52 years old, married, and mother of 6 children. She lives in the February 3 district in Maputo. She entered the program in May of 2007 with a loan of $250US. She sells new clothes on foot and also makes deliveries to collect payments at the end of the month. She is asking for the same loan amount as before for a period of 6 months to use in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Carolina Aflredo B. M. tem 52 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 6 filhos. Vive no bairro 3 de Fevereiro em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Maio de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vende roupa nova de forma ambulante e também faz entregas para recolher o valor no final do mês. Vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 6 meses para aplicar no seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 52 year old man. He lives in the South Lebanon, in the region of Saida, with his wife and three children. This is the fourth time Ali is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Ali owns a store in which he sells auto parts. He needs $1200 to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Iim

texts.en: Iim is 35 years old and has a 14-year-old child. She sells clothes on credit and usually earns US$ 5 per day. Her husband, A., is a laborer who earns US$ 1.50 per day. Iim is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more clothes and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 27 year old man who lives with his wife and child in the region of Saida in South Lebanon.  A year ago, Ahmad opened a mini-market. He now wants to buy a coffee roaster to offer new services to his clients. Ahmad is a determined micro-entrepreneur who is constantly striving to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy a coffee roaster

loans.name: Nasr El Dine

texts.en: Nasr El Dine owns a grocery store in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. He is a very honest and trustworthy man.  He is 60 years old and lives with his wife and child. Nasr El Dine needs to buy merchandise for his shop in order to generate enough revenue to be able to fix the door to his house and to refurbish the couches in his home. This is the second time Nasr El Dine is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is 27 years old and is the mother of a child aged 10. She has a small shop where she sells snacks and groceries. She can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, M., sells ice at the market and usually earns about US$ 3.50 per day. Nina is requesting a US$ 75 loan to expand her store's inventory. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her little store with more inventory

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: Marhamat K. worked as a cook for over 22 years in the  USSR. After its  collapse she was unemployed and her husband help her to rent premises for little cafe.They used all their home furniture( tables and chairs and kitchen dishes)for her cafe.Today her business is going well. Due to her abilities as excellent cook her cafe has attracted many clients. Currently her problems are shortage of dinnerwares,tables and chairs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will help her to solve this problem and she can develop her business.

loans.use: For purchasing dinnerware,tables and chairs for  her cafe.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: "LAPO has lifted my business," says Mrs. Margaret A., who sells cooked food and drinks.  She is a LAPO member and she needs a loan of $275 to buy foodstuffs for cooking food to sell.  She is 48 years old, married and has 8 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Een

texts.en: Een is 25 years old and is the mother of a child aged 3. She sells crispy snacks at her house and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Her husband, A., is a motorcycle driver who earns about US$ 2 per day. Een is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods to sell and make her little business more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell from her home

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is a 30 year old man who lives with his wife and two children in in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Amin owns a grocery store.  He is planning to buy a car. He therefore needs a loan to buy merchandise to generate greater revenue. This is the second time Amin is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. Amin is known to be a reliable micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 31 year old man who lives with his wife and child in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Bilal owns a bakery. He is planning to develop his business. He therefore needs to buy an electrical oven, tables and merchandise to be able to sustain and improve his bakery. Bilal is asking for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: to buy an electrical oven, tables and merchandise

loans.name: Carlota Isaura

texts.pt:
Carlota Isaura B. is 31 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She lives in the Maxaquene district in Maputo. She entered the program in January of 2007 with a loan of 5.000MT. She has a stand where she sells drinks and sodas in the same district. This is her third loan cycle and was able to repay the first two on time. This third cycle she is asking for $500US for 6 months and plans to replenish her stock to meet the high demand of the festive season that is approaching.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Carlota Isaura B. tem 31 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de dois filhos.Vive no bairro da Maxaquene em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Janeiro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 5.000MT. Tem uma barraca de vendas de bebidas e refrigerantes no mesmo bairro. Está no terceiro ciclo de empréstimo e reembolsou os anteriores dois pontualmente. Vai ao 3º ciclo e vai tomar 12.000MT pagáveis em 6 meses com vista a reforçar o stock com vista a fazer face à alta procura na quadra festiva que se avizinha.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 28 year old man who lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. He is a very ambitious young man. Mustafa owns a workshop that services industriA. equipment. This is the fourth time Mustafa is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He is requesting $1200 to expand his business and open a new workshop.

loans.use: to open a new workshop

loans.name: Nining

texts.en: Nining is 35 years old and has an 18-year-old child. She buys sandals on credit for re-sale and can earn US$ 5 per week. Her husband, N., is a laborer who earns US$ 4 per day. Nining is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Mrs. Cecilia O. is 45 years old, married and has 8 children  She lives in Benin City and sells cooked food and drinks.  She has been in the business since 2001, and is a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $200 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for cooking.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 47 year old mother of four children. Fatima is a very serious and committed microentrepreneur.  She lives in South Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Fatima works with her husband cooking falafel, chickpeas and beans. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy a new chickpea processor and provisions for the business. This is the sixth time Fatima is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy a chickpeas, a processor and provisions

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 26 years old and the mother of three children. Marwa is a very ambitious woman. She lives and works in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Marwa is a hairdresser. She needs to buy merchandise for her beauty shop and is also planning to purchase clothing to display and sell in the shop. This is the third time Marwa is seeking a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Sukarsih

texts.en: Sukarsih is 30 years old and has a 3-year-old child. She has a small food stall where she sells snacks and beverages. She can earn about US$ 10 per day. Her husband, B., is a motorcycle driver who earns US$ 2.50 per day. Sukarsih is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods to fill her stall. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expnd the inventory of her stall

loans.name: Mumun

texts.en: Mumun is 27 years old and has an 11-year-old child. She has a small grocery store where she sells snacks and household goods. She can earn about US$ 20 per day. Her husband, S., is a motorcycle driver who earns US$ 2.50 per day. Mumun is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods for her grocery store. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Mr. Paul N. is 42 years old, married and has 5 children.  He lives in Benin City.  He sells cooked food and drinks to people living in his community.  He is a dedicated LAPO member and he needs a loan of $250 to buy more foodstuffs for  cooking food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Mr. Saturday Ulehor is 32 years old, married and has one child.  He hails from Benin City.  He operates a drug store and has been in this business since 1999.  He is requesting a the loan of $525 to enable him buy more drugs to stock his store.  He promises to pay back this loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his drug store

loans.name: Subgroup C Of Group Tuwezeshane

texts.en:
DIA, age 54, runs a small cafe from the porch of her home, which she calls “Mama Kingwiti.” She began this business in 1971. She serves food from 6am-10pm daily, charging an average of 45-55 cents per plate. Every day, Dia makes about $5.50-6.50 from her business. She has been using the profits to make repairs on their house. A long term goal of hers is to one day get electricity in their home.

While Dia and her husband live alone, they have 7 grown children. Some of their children still help Dia cook and serve at her café. Her husband is a retired City Council member.

Dia is the leader of Subgroup C of group Tuwezeshane (meaning “let’s help each other” in Swahili), which totals 24 members. Dia will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Kidawa S. (food vendor), Kasim R. (tailor), Asha K. (selling clothes), and Salma M. (selling charcoal). Her subgroup has shared 3 previous loans, which they paid back successfully.

Dia used the previous loans to increase the food supply of her café. She hopes to use the new loan to do the same in order to continue their house repairs.

In the picture, Dia is on the far right.

loans.use: To increase her cafe's food supply

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth Q. lives with her son in Anticretico in the Pasankeri zone on the west side of La Paz. Mrs. Elizabeth is the caretaker of a building in the Sopocachi zone. Her brother has a piece of land in the same zone that has a rough-built room. Mrs. Elizabeth’s objective is to finish the construction of the rooms and add a bathroom so she can live there and leave Anticretico. The credit she is requesting will go toward the finer details of the construction of her house and a bathroom. This is the first time she has requested a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies her favorably for a loan. This type of credit falls under the remodeling line of our Dwelling program.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth Q. vive en Anticretico en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hijo. La señora Elizabeth es portera en un edificio de la zona de Sopocachi. Su hermano mayor tiene un terreno en la misma zona que tiene una habitación edificada en obra gruesa, la señora Elizabeth tiene el objetivo de concluir la construcción de la habitación más un baño, para poder vivir allí y dejar el anticretico. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en obra fina y un baño. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Este tipo de crédito cae bajo nuestro programa de Vivienda, línea refacción

loans.use: Construction of house and bath

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionisio J. lives in his home in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto with his wife and 3 children. He’s a construction worker for a private contruction company in his city. With the help of 4 previous loans, he was able to build 4 rooms in his home. He is requesting this latest loan in order to construct 2 additional rooms, which will ultimately be used to open a small general store, thus creating an additional source of income for the family that will improve their standard of living. This is the fifth time he is requesting a loan, and his socioeconomic analysis (credit check) favorably qualifies him to take out an additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Dionisio J. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Dionicio trabaja como obrero constructor en construcciones privadas en su ciudad. Con los créditos anteriores (cuatro) realizaron la construcción de cuatro habitaciones que forman parte del proyecto de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones cuyo fin es el de instalar una tienda de barrio con la que podrán generar una fuente de ingresos que mejorará sus condiciones de vida. Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito

loans.use: Construction of 2 rooms to be used as a general store

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salomé rents a home that she has divided into two sections: she has a general store in the front half, and lives in the back half. The house is located on Ascencion Padilla Street in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a taxi driver from 7:00am, and she generates revenue through her general store, thus contributing to the total family income. She will use this loan for the maintenance and repair of her husband’s taxi.

Because of her good credit history with IMPRO (member since 2002), she qualifies to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Salomé vive en una habitación alquilada la cual la dividió en dos partes: en la parte de adelante instalo su tienda y en la parte de atrás es su vivienda. El domicilio está ubicado en la calle Ascencio Padilla de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como taxista desde las 7:00am de la mañana y ella genera sus ingresos con la tienda de abarrotes, complementando de esta manera al ingreso total familiar. El crédito que ahora solicita es para reparar y hacer el mantenimiento del taxi con el cual el marido trabaja.

Por su antecedente Histórico con IMPRO (cliente desde el año 2002) puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of her husband’s taxi

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr.  Emmanuel B. is 42 years old, married, with 7 children.He buys rubber latex from different villages and sells to factory .Rubber latex is use for the production of plastics,slippers etc.He has been a LAPO client since 2004. Mr. B. needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more rubber latex for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rubber latex for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth I. is 58 years old, married, with 7 children. She is a member of LAPO and needs a loan of US$525 to buy more oil and other provisions for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of more oil and other provisions for sale

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra K. is 48 years old and the wife of a polygamist. She has 3 children and looks after the family’s expenses and schooling. She has been retailing pagnes (strips of traditional printed African fabric used to wrap around the body to form a short skirt) for 15 years and almost all her income comes from this activity. She knows the business inside out. Her clientele is growing significantly. She would like to use this loan to increase her stock of merchandise. Mrs. K. has been a client of FECECAV for 3 years. She has had 3 loans and has repaid all of them successfully.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Abra K. est âgée de 48 ans et femme d'un mari polygamme. Elle a 3 enfants et les charges familiales et scolaires sont prises par elle. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 15 ans et la quasi totalité de ses revenus proviennent de son activité. Elle maîtrise bien le secteur de pagnes(tissus imprimés). Elle a une clientèle en pleine croissance. Avec cet emprunt elle désire augmenter son stocks de marchandises. Madame Abra est cliente de FECECAV depuis 3 ans . Elle a bénéficié de 3 crédit et tous ont été remboursé avec succès.

loans.use: To buy 2 bundles of traditional cloth (containing 120 pieces each) to sell at retail

loans.name: Mhamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed S. is 28 years old and the father of three children, all of whom are at school. He meets the needs of his family by the income he makes from his business. With this loan Mohamed intends to increase the capacity of his small store in order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of his customers. He has been in business for more than 10 years, which has given him expertise in all areas of the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mohamed S. est âgé de 28 ans et père de 3 enfants tous à l'école. Il subvient au besoins de la famille par les profits réalisés sur son commerce. Avec cet emprunt Mohamed compte augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour satisfaire aux besoins sans cesse croîssants de ses clients. Il est exerce cet activité de plus de 10 ans ce qui lui favorise une maîtrise de tous les rouages du secteur.

loans.use: To buy 10 cases of milk, 15 bags of rice, 8 bags of sugar, 10 cases of canned food

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi B. is married and the mother of 2 children, She installed her stall close to the bus station. She provides over 50% of the household expenses with the profit from her business. Mrs. Essi has been practicing this activity for over 5 years. She stocks up in the surrounding villages and comes back to sell them in town.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Essi B. est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a installé sa baraque tout près de la gare routière. Elle participe à plus de 50% aux charges de la famille avec les bénéfices réalisés sur ces activités. Madame Essi exerce ce métier plus de 5 ans. Elle s'approvienne dans les villages environnants et revient les livrer en ville.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of avocados, 10 baskets of bananas, 15 bags of oranges

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Mr. Joel M. is 71 years of age, married, and lives with his wife. He retired from “Entidad Binacional Yacyretá,” where he worked for many years. With his pension, he was able to both build several apartments to lease and open a general store.

He tells us that his main motivation for opening the general store was his wife, since they planned on making a living off the houses they leased.

The general store carries a wide variety of products such as sugar, vegetables, sweets, cleaning supplies, toilet paper, soap, etc.

Since sales tend to augment towards the end of the year, Mr. M. would like to increase his inventory. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he--being the excellent member of Fundación Paraguaya that he is--will repay in monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Joel M. tiene 71 años, está casado y vive con su esposa. Es jubilado de la Entidad Binacional Yacyretá, donde trabajo por muchos años; con el dinero cobrado por su indemnización construyó varios departamentos para alquilar y abrió una despensa.

El nos cuenta que la principal propulsora para abrir la despensa fue su esposa, ya que ellos tenían planeado vivir de las casas que alquilaban..

Su despensa está bien surtida, vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, verduras, golosinas, artículos para el hogar como productos de limpieza, papel higiénico, jabones, etc..

En vista de que a fin de año aumentan considerablemente las ventas, don Joel desea aumentar su stock de mercadería, para ello solicita un crédito que lo pagará puntualmente de forma mensual, ya que el mismo es uno de los clientes excelentes de la Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: Purchase of canned goods, sweets, soft drinks, fruit, vegetables, cleaning supplies, etc..

loans.name: Sallay Papa

texts.en: Sallay was born in the Portloko district of Sierra Leone and was married to a carpenter in Magburaka.  Sally lost her husband, however, and now, as a 49-year-old widow, she is left to take care of her 6 children.  With her previous loan from SMT, Sallay managed to earn enough  income from her fish-selling business to meet her family’s expenses and start building her own capital.   She is requesting another loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: to continue the positive growth of her fish-selling business

loans.name: Narah

texts.en: Narah S. is 31 years old and married with 3 children.  Her husband is also a petty trader and the couple is working hard to earn enough income to manage their family expenses and to buy land for their future house.  Narah sells African cotton print materials in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  With her previous loan she diversified her business, increasing her inventory and income.  She plans to expand her business further in order to build a family house and is therefore requesting a loan.

loans.use: to continue to build her business by diversifying and increasing her inventory

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 35 years old and married with  three children.  She runs a little restaurant in the open-air market of Magburaka town.  Her business is the main income-generating activity for the family as her husband has irregular income.  With her previous loan, Siah managed to purchase her ingredients such as rice, palm oil, tomato paste, etc. wholesale.  This reduced her expenses and increased her income and time spent managing the business rather than making frequent purchases.  Siah is happy with the SMT program and is requesting another loan so that she can  construct a better shelter for the business.

loans.use: construct a more suitable shelter for her restaurant so as to generate new business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is a young entrepreneur who at age 27 already owns two commercial stands in the municipal market where he sells vegetables.

He started as a longshoreman and as a helper for others that had commercial stands at the same market; he saved some money and after receiving a good offer he was able to buy his own stand.

His business has gone well, and as such he was able to buy another stand, which is attended by his brother. They open every day from 2 am till 5 pm, and he sells all sorts of vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuce, onions, etc.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy merchandise in bigger quantities, as in this time of the year when a greater amoung of the sales take place.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo es un hombre joven y emprendedor, con tal solo 27 años el ya es dueño de dos puestos de ventas de verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Empezó como estibador y ayudante de unos señores que también poseían locales de ventas de verduras en ese mismo mercado; junto unos ahorros y luego de recibir una buena oferta, Ricardo se animó a comprar un puesto de ventas con algunas mercaderías.

Cuenta que le va bien y que gracias a las ganancias que le genero su primer puesto, adquirió otro más que es atendido por su hermano. Abre todos los días a las 2 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Vende todo tipo de verduras como tomates, morrones, lechugas, cebollas, etc.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades, ya que en esta época del año es cuando se registran mayor cantidad de ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as tomatoes, onions, lettuce, carrots, red peppers.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu S. is single and planning for her future.  A school drop-out, she lives with her elder sister.  She is 25 years old and sells household utensils in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.    Isatu expanded her business with the loan accessed from SMT and will complete her repayment in January, 2008. She is requesting another loan to further expand her home products sales.

loans.use: to grow her business and increase her income from it

loans.name: Abdul Babah

texts.en: Abdul joined SMT for the purpose of expanding his business selling spare parts.  His wife runs a small tailoring shop with 3 sewing machines to supplement the family’s income.  With his previous loans, Abdul diversified his business and has built a good relationship with SMT.  He will complete his installments for his most recent loan at the end of December and would like a loan of $1200 to further increase his stock so that he would be able to sell spare parts wholesale to smaller retailers.

loans.use: To further expand his business and begin selling his spare parts wholesale to smaller retailers

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 31 years old and married with 2 children.  He runs a business buying palm kernels from local subsistence farmers and selling them to local industries in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.  James' previous loan allowed him to increase his stock from two bags to four (one hundred kilogram) bags of palm kernels at a time.  He is requesting another loan to double his purchases again and increase his income.

loans.use: to increase his business income and lower his operating expenses by purchasing more at a time

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Mr. Celso Martinez works in furniture manufacturing and sales. This business, which he and his wife run, is his family's sole source of income. They would like to invest in the business without losing profits, so they are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy the materials needed to manufacture wood furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Celso M. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera y venta. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Queremos invertir le mas al negocio pero sin descapitalizarnos. Así que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles de madera.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make wood furniture

loans.name: Rosario 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 30 years of age, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is a farm laborer who works in the cultivation of flowers. Maria and the rest of the members of her group create embroidery work such as table linens, napkins, and blouses because this activity is most popular among the women of her community. They sell their traditional products to the tourists in the area because they are beautifully-designed and colorful handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , TIENE 30 AÑOS ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS , SU MARIDO TRABAJA COMO CAMPESINO EN EL CULTIVO D. FLORES . ELL. SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR Y BORDAR PRENDAS D. ARTESANIA TALES COMO : MANTELES , SERVILLETAS , BLUSAS , AL IGUAL QUE TODAS LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO YA QUE ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE MAS AUGE TIENE ENTRE LAS MUJERES D. SU COMUNIDAD . SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDEN CON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN L. ZONA YA QUE SON TRADICIONALES LOS BORDADOS MUY BONITOS POR SU GRAN COLORIDO Y DISEÑO.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and fabric to distribute among the members of the group

loans.name: Totorilla Group

texts.es:
The Totorilla Community Bank started 6 months ago and actually has 2 cycles and 19 members. The bank has the name of the community where all of its members live. Totorilla is a small valley where most of the population dedicates themselves to agriculture. Their lands produce coriander, spinach, cabbage, lettuce, and alfalfa. They are also dedicated to raise small farm animals and cattle in small proportion.

The members do different activities like mototaxi service, agriculture, raising farm animals and selling groceries, fruits, propane gas and beverages. In Yolanda's, Olga"s and Pecina's case they work in the agricultural fields; something that they learned since young and presently they work together with their husbands. They cultivate spinach, coriander, cabbage, lettuce and alfalfa and also raise small farm animals and cattle in small proportion. They sell their own products at wholesale and retail in a local public market named Nery G. Zarate.

The members need loans in different amounts, some amounts are 300 soles(Peruvian currency), 600 soles, 900 soles being a total of 8600 soles in loans for the Totorilla Community Bank. The money will be invested in buying seeds,fertilizers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, propane gas, tires for a motorcycle and also to buy "cuy" ( a typical Peruvian animal) to be raised. The members are also learning parenting skills, how to raise, feed, and educate their children, and how to be responsible citizens. Their dreams are all different some want their children to become professionals, some want them to own their farm, land, and home and some of them dream of buying a car someday.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal Totorilla se inició hace 6 meses y actualmente tiene 2 ciclos y 19socias, y lleva el nombre D. la comunidad, D. donD. son todos los socios. Totorilla es un pequeño valle donD. su población se dedica a la agricultura, sus tierras producen culantro, espinaca, culantro, col, lechuga, alfalfa, además se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y engorD. D. ganado en menor proporción. Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como servicios D. mototaxi, la agricultura, crianza D. animales y venta D. abarrotes, frutas, gas propano y bebidas. Es el caso D. Yolanda, Olga y Pecina que se dedican a la agricultura, actividad que aprendieron desD. muy pequeñas y ahora lo hacen junto a sus esposos. Ellas cultivan espinaca, culantro, col, lechuga, alfalfa y, además se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y engorD. D. ganado. La venta D. sus productos lo hacen ellas mismas en el mercado Nery García Zarate al por mayor y menor. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8600 soles D. préstamos para el Banco Comunal Totorilla. El dinero será invertido en la compra D. semillas, abono, arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, gas propano, llantas para la moto y también para comprar cuy para la crianza. Las socias están aprendiendo sobre cómo educar a los hijos, cómo alimentarlos, a ser puntuales y responsables. Los sueños D. los socios son diferentes como que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una granja, un terreno y luego una casa y hasta comprar un carro.

loans.use: The members need different loan amounts.Some amounts are 300 soles (Peruvian currency), 600 soles, and 900 soles for a total amount of 8600 soles in loans for the Totorilla Community Bank.  The money will be invested in buying seeds, fertilizers, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, propane gas, tires for a motorcycle and also to buy  "cuy" ( a typical Peruvian animal) to be raised.

loans.name: Manuela's Group

texts.es:
Manuela, Sabina, and Graciela are members of the Despertar Community Bank since 12, 11 and 10 years ago. At their community bank they learn values, self-esteem, and how to move their households forward. They tell us that at their beginnings no one wanted to take the risk of assuming the job of the board of directors due to fear. Now things are different and they face the challenges ahead

Manuela sells cereals and processed products like moron, manioc, wheat and peeled corn which she elaborates. In the meantime, Sabina makes bricks and Graciela has a grocery stores. Their loans are in the amounts of 600 soles (Peruvian currency0, 1000 soles, and 800 soles respectively. They will invest the money in buying wheat, barley, corn, chick peas, rice, lima beans, milk, oil, preserves, sugar, soap, and to pay for laborers. They will use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses. The dreams of Manuela, Sabina and Graciela are to have a stable location where they can sell their products, have a bigger business, have a hardware store, that her children become professionals, and to be able to improve their houses and be able to rent them

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela, Sabina y Graciela son socias del Banco Comunal Despertar hace 12, 11 y 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal les enseñaron los valores, la autoestima y a llevar adelante su hogar. Ellas cuentan que en un inicio nadie quería asumir cargos D. la junta directiva por temor, ahora las cosas son diferentes y asumen los retos. Manuela venD. cereales y productos procesados como morón, ulpada, trigo y maíz pelado que ella misma hace, mientras que Sabina fabrica ladrillos D. construcción y Graciela tiene su tienda D. abarrotes. Sus préstamos son D. 600 soles, 1000 soles y 800 soles que los invertirán en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz, garbanzo, pallar, arroz, leche, aceite, conservas, azúcar, jabón y para el pago D. la mano D. obra (peones). Sus ahorros los utilizarán para aumentar el capital D. su negocio. Los sueños D. Manuela, Sabina y Graciela son tener un puesto estable para poder vender sus productos, tener un negocio mas granD., tener una ferretería, que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su casa para poder arrendar.

loans.use: Their loans are in the amounts of 600 soles (Peruvian currency0, 1000 soles, and 800 soles respectively.  They will invest the money in buying wheat, barley, corn, chick peas, rice, lima beans, milk, oil, preserves, sugar, soap, and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 28 years and has 3 children. She is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Norma, together with her husband, sells children's clothing and have 2 stores at a local mall located in the Ayacucho city center. Norma started this business some years ago as a door to door saleswoman in the city of Lima. She also traveled to other provinces taking and selling her merchandise. It was during one of these trips to Ayacucho that she had her baby and she was not able to return to Lima because she had a C-section. That's when Norma decided to start her business in this city.

She began with a small stand where she had not too much merchandise but slowly with the loans that the community bank lend her and her savings her business began to grow. Now she has 2 stores and also has goals for her business like having a dressmaking shop and a place of their own.

She needs a 3,000 soles loan that will invest in buyingsuits, pants, polos, coats, and wardrobes and also the remodelation of her store. In her community bank, she has share happiness and sorrows that she has able to overcome with the help of her friends like when one of their members had an accident and they did a fundraiser to cover its medical expenses. Her dreams are to have a wedding and get married, have their own place, keep her family together and have a well establish dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Norma, junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de niños y tienen 2 tiendas en una galería que está ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Norma inició este negocio hace muchos años como ambulante en la ciudad de Lima pero también viajaba a provincias llevando mercadería. En uno de los viajes a Ayacucho ella tuvo a su bebé, y no podía regresar a Lima porque tuvo un parto por cesárea y fue por ello que ella decidió iniciar su negocio en esta ciudad. Comenzó con un pequeño puesto donde tenía muy poca mercadería y poco a poco con los créditos que le otorgó su Banco Comunal y los ahorros que tenía fue creciendo. Ahora tiene 2 tiendas y también tiene otras metas para su negocio como el tener un taller de confección de ropa y tener un local propio. El préstamo que ella necesita es de 3,000 soles que invertirá en la compra de conjuntos, pantalones, polos, ropones, ajuares y para la remodelación de su tienda. En su Banco Comunal ha compartido tristezas y alegrías que se superaron con ayuda de todas sus amigas, como cuando un socio se accidentó e hicieron una pollada para recaudar dinero para su curación. Los sueños de Norma son casarse, tener local propio, mantener su familia unida y tener un taller bien implementado.

loans.use: The loan that she needs is for 3,000 soles(Peruvian currency) which will be invested in buying suits, pants, polos, coats, and wardrobes and also the remodelation of her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has been a member of the Comunal Kutimuy Bank for 4 years. "Kutimuy" is an indigenous word which means "return", Esther is the president of this roup. She tells us that at first she was scared of becoming a member because she wasn't sure of being able to pay back these loans. Her friends encouraged her a lot and told her that women are able to move ahead in society and this is what she did. Esther has a kiosk where she sells breads, sodas, candies and many other things. She's been running this business for 18 years. She tells us that with the first loan she got, she was able to provide for her store and support her home.

Esther has three children of her own. Their ages are 15, 12, and 4 years old. They are the whole reason for her existence! Her loan will help her purchase sodas, gum, cigars, candies, liquor, cookies/crackers and phone cards. The savings will help her buy land so that she can build a house. Her dream is to have a modest home and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy desde hace 4 años. Kutimuy es una palabra quechua que significa “regresa” y del cual Esther es Presidenta. Ella cuenta que al inicio tenía temor de ser socia porque creía que no podría pagar los préstamos y sus compañeras le ayudaron mucho y le enseñaron que las mujeres sí pueden salir adelante y así lo hizo. Esther tiene un kiosco donde vende panes, gaseosas, dulces y otros productos mas, este negocio lo realiza hace 18 años, ella cuenta que con su primer préstamo surtió su negocio y comenzó a mantener sola su hogar. Esther tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12, y 4 años que son su razón de vivir. Su préstamo es de 3000 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de gaseosas, chicles, cigarros, caramelos, licores, galletas y tarjetas telefónicas. Sus ahorros los utilizará para la compra de un terreno y luego para la construcción de su casa. Su Sueño es tener una casa propia de material noble y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, bubble gum, cigars, candy, liquor, cookies/crackers and phone cards.

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es:
Ms. Marta Iris O. Guzman is a 41 year old woman from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Mr. Margarito Torres, and they have 4 older children. Ms. O. has been able to pay for the studies of her children thanks to the earnings from her business. She owns a stand where she sells cheese and cream, and she has more than 20 years of experience in this business. Her clients are parents and the supervisors that work in the judicial system and the hospital. At this point Ms. O. needs to buy 298 pounds of cheese (at $1/pound) and 80 pounds of cream (at $0.65/pound) with which she will be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marta Iris O. G. tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Margarito Torres, ambos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, cabe señalar que a la Sra. O. a podido pagar los estudios de sus hijos con el ingreso de su negocio. La Sra. O. es propietaria de un tramo donde vende queso y crema, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, sus clientes son los padres de familia, los encargados del Sistema Judicial, los encargados del Hospital. En estos momentos la Sra. O. necesita comprar 298 libras de queso a $1.00 dólar la libra y 80 libras de crema a $0.65 centavos dólar la libra con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de las instituciones y de los padres de familia.

loans.use: To buy cheese and cream

payments.comment: La Cuota real que pago es de $43.75 dólares.
la cuota real es de $43.75 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 44.75 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 43.75 dólares.

loans.name: Dionisia's Group

texts.es:
Dionisia, Olga, and Yolanda are members of the Kutimuy Community Bank since 14, 3 and 1 year, respectively. Kutimuy is a Quechua word that means "to return". Dionisia has been making handicrafts in a loom for 25 years and she sells her products directly and also through middlemen. Together with her husband Yolanda elaborates dairy products like: yogurt, ice cream, and cheeses. They sell them door to door. Olga is dedicated to sell groceries at a kiosk.

At their community bank, they had learned to raise and educate their kids without violence and to live in harmony. They need loans for the amounts of 400 soles(Peruvian currency), 1200 soles, and 1500 soles respectively. They will invest it in buying dyes, firewood, wool, milk, sugar, bags, carbonated beverages, yogurt, cookies, sweets, liquors,and shampoo.

Dionisia's, Olga's, and Yolanda's dreams are to be able to have a store that sell supplies for looms and loomscrafts, have their own houses, that their children become professionals and a store where they can sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

 Dionisia, Olga y Yolanda son socias del Banco Comunal Kutimuy desD. hace 14, 3 y 1 año, respectivamente. Kutimuy es una palabra quechua que significa “regresa”. Dionisia realiza artesanías en telar desD. hace 25 años y sus productos los venD. a intermediarios y directamente. Yolanda, junto a su esposo elaboran productos lácteos como yogurt, helados, quesos y la venta lo realiza ambulatoriamente y por otro lado, el negocio D. Olga es la venta D. abarrotes en un kiosco. En su Banco Comunal ellas han aprendido a educar a los hijos sin violencia y a vivir en armonía. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles, 1200 soles y 1500 soles respectivamente que lo invertirán en la compra D. tintes, leña, lana, leche, azúcar, bolsas, gaseosa, yogurt, galletas caramelos, licores, champú. Los sueños D. Dionisia, Olga y Yolanda son tener una tienda que venda insumos para telares, tener una casa propia, que sus hijos sean profesionales y una tienda D. venta al por mayor.

loans.use: They need loans for the amounts of 400 soles(Peruvian currency), 1200 soles, and 1500 soles respectively.  They will invest it in buying dyes, firewood, wool, milk, sugar, bags, carbonated beverages, yogurt, cookies, sweets, liquors,and shampoo.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marina belongs to the Activas Communal Bank and lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali department. She is 47 years old and is the mother of five children. Her husband is a retired professor, but his income doesn’t cover their expenses. That’s why Marina decided to use her first loan of $100 to open a small sewing shop and sell juices.

Currently, she relies on a small juice stand in the Bellavista market as well as the sewing shop she maintains out of her home. She gets up at 4:00am to go to the market, purchase the stock for her juice sales, and in the afternoon she dedicates herself to her sewing. Her children go to high school, and support their mother in their spare time.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for $850, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase 30 meters of fabric, a dozen units of thread, a metric measuring tape, a packet of pins, and oil to maintain her sewing machine. Marina is very pleased to see her business prosper, as it is a very important success for her; thanks to it, she has been able to achieve well being for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa Mz. D Lt. 11, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es profesor jubilado, y el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Marina, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide poner una pequeña su taller de costura y venta de jugos.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de jugos en el mercado Bellavista, paralelamente tiene instalado en su casa un pequeño taller de costura. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir al mercado, comprar sus insumos para la venta de jugos y en la tarde se dedica a la costura. Sus hijos van al colegio y en sus ratos libres apoyan a su madre.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500, (US$ 837 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 30 metros de tela, 1 docena de hilos, una cinta métrica, 1 paquete de alfileres y aceite para dar mantenimiento a la maquina de coser. Marina está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, gracias a éste ha podido alcanzar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fabric and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha belongs to the Activas communal bank and lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali department. She is the 59-year-old mother of six children, and her husband is a carbon salesman. Thanks to her first loan from Manuela Ramos for $100, she decided to open a small store where she sells retail groceries. Currently, she relies on this grocery store that she runs out of her own home. She wakes up early to prepare breakfast for her children, and then devotes herself to her business.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for $625, which she will repay in five months, she will stock her grocery with three boxes of milk, three boxes and one package of crackers, eight boxes of eggs, two units of canned goods, four palettes of toilet paper, and one packet of noodles. Martha is very pleased to see her business prosper; thanks to it, she is earning her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Activas, vive en el Pasaje Micaela Bastidas Mz. 32 Lt. 15, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 59 años de edad y es madre de 6 hijos, su espeso es carbonero (venta de carbón). Gracias al primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decidió poner una pequeña bodega para la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su propia casa, se levanta temprano para preparar el desayuno a sus hijos, y después de dedica a su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,800, (US$ 603.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su bodega con 03 cajas de leche, 03 cajas de galletas, 08 cajas de huevo, 02 doc. de conservas, 04 planchas de papel higiénico, 01 paquete de fideo, 01 paquete de galletas. Martha está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, y gracias a él está logrando el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted groceries

loans.name: Graciela's Group

texts.es:
Severo, Graciela and Angélica are partners of the Sumaq Ayllu Community bank. Sumaq Ayllu is a quechua word which means “pretty family”.

At their Community Bank, they have learned about responsibility, honesty, punctuality and most important, how to save. Angelica had been partner of another Community Bank before and with her savings, she bought merchandise and later on she could build her house.

They all do different activities. Graciela and Severo buy cereals and vegetables that they sell during the carnivals/markets of the region. Moreover, Graciela owns 2 cars that she uses for public transportation. Angelica tailors clothes, also makes clothes to dress the saints at the church, makes typical dolls (huamanguinas) and other handcrafts.

Their loans are respectively of 600 soles (200 usd), 1250 soles (425 usd) and 600 soles (200 usd) that they will invest purchasing cereals, potatoes, cloth, thread, sequins and toys to sell during the Christmas period.

Severo and Angélica will use their savings for the graduation and university admission of their respective kids and to expand their business. Graciela dreams about having a transportation company, and covering all the needs of her kids so they can learn a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, Angélica y Severo son socios del Banco Comunal Sumaq Ayllu, palabra quechua que significa “Bonita Familia”.

En su Banco Comunal han aprendido la responsabilidad, la honestidad, la puntualidad y sobre todo a ahorrar. Angélica anteriormente fue socia en otro Banco Comunal y con los ahorros que reunió pudo comprar sus artefactos e hizo su casa.

Las actividades que realizan son distintas, Angélica confecciona prendas D. vestir, muñecas huamanguinas, manualidades y ropa para santos. Por otro lado Severo y Graciela compran y venden cereales y verduras que venden en las diferentes ferias D. la zona. Además Graciela tiene 2 carros que hacen servicio D. transporte público.

Sus Préstamos son D. 600 soles, 1250 soles y 600 soles respectivamente que serán invertidos en la compra D. cereales, papa, olluco, telas, hilos, lentejuelas y juguetes para vender en la campaña naviD.ña.

Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la titulación D. su hijo, ingreso a la universidad e incrementar su negocio. Los sueños que tienen son tener una empresa D. transporte, sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Severo, Graciela and Angélica request $200, $425 and $200 usd respectively, that they will invest purchasing cereals, potatoes, cloth, thread, sequins and toys to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Mrs. Ruth works is part of the las Activas Communal Bank and lives in the district of Calleria of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and is single. Thanks to the first loan she received of $100 she was able to create a small business selling clothes, soft drinks, beer and ice pops.

She has a little store located in her own house. She wakes up at six in the morning every day to go to the market and make breakfast. For the rest of the day she dedicates herself to her business.

With the recent loan she requests of $334 she will buy three boxes of soft drinks, nine loads of beer, three boxes of nectar, four of yogurt, three packets of bags for ice pops, and four loads of fruit. The loan will be repayed in five months. With the rest of the money she will invest in clothing.

Ruth is very happy to see her business prosper because it is a very important achievement to her.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en Jr. Unión Mz. 6 Lt. 9, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera.
