Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decidió poner un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa al por menor, bebidas gaseosas, cervezas y chupetes (paletas de hielo).

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su misma casa, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para ir al mercado y hacer el desayuno, y después de dedica ala venta en su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.000, (US$ 334.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 03 cajas de gaseosa, 09 cajas de cerveza, 03 cajas de néctar, 04 de yogurt, 03 paquetes de bolsas para chupetes, 02 masas de aguaje (fruta de la zona), 02 masas de hungurahuina (fruta de la zona) y S/. 500.00 serán invertidos en la compra de prendas de vestir.

Ruth esta muy contenta de al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, fruit, and clothing

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas are members of the Legion Community Bank since 5, 14 and 4 years respectively.

They all say that through the Community Bank they learned to be punctual, responsible and to be affectionate with their children.

Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas are all street vendors. Maximiliana creates textile handcrafts like rugs, blankets, and clothes that she sells at the market. Monica sells filled-potatoes that she cooks herself and Felicitas sells eggs at the Nery García Zarate market.

In the future, they would like their businesses to improve, they would like to sell in a safe place and have their own shop.

Therefore, they would like to borrow 400, 1600 and 400 soles respectively that they will invest buying more wool, eggs, oil and potatoes to profit from the Christmas’ sales increase.

Moreover, Monica would like to buy bread, chocolate and milk to sell at the city’s Christmas Market.

Maximiliana dreams to have capital to replenish her business. Mónica would like to own a restaurant of her own and Felicitas would like to later on buy a car that she will use for public transportation. They all dream to see their children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximiliana, Mónica y Felicitas son socias del Banco Comunal Legión hace 5, 14 y 4 años respectivamente.

Ellas cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y también a ser amorosas con sus hijos.

Felicitas venD. huevos ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García Zarate, mientras que Maximiliana realiza artesanía en textiles como pisos, frazadas, pasadizos y los venD. en el mercado. Mónica es ambulante y venD. papa rellena que ella misma prepara.

En el futuro ellas quieren que sus negocios mejoren, les gustaría vender en un lugar seguro y tener su propio local.

Sus préstamos son D. 400 soles, 1600 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en la compra D. huevos, menestras, curtiembres, lana procesada, aceite, papa, y por campaña D. navidad Mónica comprará panetones, chocolates y leche para venderlos en una feria naviD.ña D. la ciudad.

Los sueños D. Maximiliana, Mónica y Felicitas son comprar un carro para realizar transporte público, tener capital propio para surtir su negocio, tener un restaurante en un local adecuado y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Maximiliana, Mónica and Felicitas would like to borrow 400, 1600 and 400 soles respectively that they will invest buying wool, eggs, oil and potatoes to profit from the Christmas’ sales increase. Moreover, Monica would like to buy bread, chocolate and milk to sell at the city’s Christmas Market

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Otilia is 57 years old, and has six independent children. She never went to school because her father did not consider it important. Mrs. Otilia is a native of Huancabamba (Piura), which is where she met the man who is now her husband. She went with him to live in Cascas, where they had farmland that her husband irresponsibly sold. They then went to live in Trujillo with their six children; she felt the need to work now that her husband did not contribute to the home. That’s how she started her business selling snow cones, fruit, and sandwiches in the streets of the city. Sometime later, some friends told her she could do better by selling assorted frozen novelties, so she switched gears. Currently, Mrs. Otilia lives in the Huanchaco district in the department of La Libertad and devotes herself to selling popsicles and gelatin desserts; during the summer, she employs three other people in selling her products. During the winter, she sells used clothing in the La Libertad sierra and in cities in the junble. With her first $100 credit that she obtained from the interim group “Radiant Sun” of Manuela Ramos, she purchased candies to sell; she did that for a while, but had to give it up because the city police constantly moved her away from the area where she sold on foot. With this loan from Manuela Ramos for $250 to be paid in four months, she will buy sugar for next summer. Mrs. Otilia dreams of having savings enough to retire comfortably in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Otilia tiene 57 años de edad, no estudió porque su padre no lo consideró importante. Tiene 6 hijos pero ya no dependen de ella. La señora Otilia es natural de Huancabamba (Piura), ahí conoció al que actualmente es su esposo y con él se fueron a vivir a Cascas donde tenían tierras de cultivo las que el esposo vendió por irresponsable; entonces vino a vivir a Trujillo con sus seis hijos y sintió la necesidad de trabajar ya que el esposo no aportaba al hogar y así inició su negocio con la venta de raspadillas, fruta y sandwich por las calle de la ciudad, después unas amigas le comentaron que se obtiene mayor utilidad vendiendo marcianos y gelatinas y entonces cambió de giro. Actualmente la señora Otilia vive en el Asentamiento Humano Ramón Castilla del Distrito de Huanchaco en el Departamento de La Libertad y se dedica a preparar y vender marcianos (paletas de hielo) y gelatina (postre) durante el verano dando trabajo a tres personas más que venden sus productos. Durante el invierno vende ropa usada en la Sierra de la Libertad y también en ciudades de la selva. Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que obtuvo en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, compró golosinas para vender, lo hizo por un tiempo pero tuvo que dejarlo porque los policías municipales la retiraban constantemente de la zona donde vendía (ambulante). Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.700.00 (aproximadamente $234) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, comprará azúcar para la preparación de los marcianos debido a que el precio está subiendo y la temporada de verano está próxima. La señora Otilia sueña con tener ahorros para afrontar su vejez y así dejar de trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar for making frozen novelties to sell next summer.

loans.name: Esther Gladys

texts.es:
Esther is 49 years old and is a fish biologist, but she doesn’t work in her field because she earns more with her own business. She lives in Laredo District in Trujillo Province in La Libertad Department.

Esther began by selling beauty products and later expanded into shoes, which she sells in the city of Chimbote, where she worked for a while. Her business has grown and she now also buys raw cow hides, which she salts and later processes for making into jackets and shoes. She also sends out the remnants to be made into jackets and wallets, which she sells to acquaintances.

She is a member of the communal bank “Laredo”, from which she obtained her first loan of S/.300.00 (approximately $100.00). She used this money to buy enough beauty products that she could have a good stock available and also sell them on credit. With the recent loan of S/. 1,200.00 (approximately $402) she has received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy a new line of beauty products and also buy more hides, which are scarce at the moment and therefore more expensive.

Esther dreams of building a comfortable home and of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther tiene 49 años de edad, es Bióloga Pesquera pero no ejerce su profesión porque considera que con su negocio le va mejor. Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de Laredo de la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Esther se inició vendiendo productos de belleza y luego amplió su negocio a venta de calzado, el mismo que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Chimbote donde trabajó por un tiempo. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido un poco más y se dedica también a comprar “cuero en pelo” para salar y luego procesarlo para la confección de casacas y calzado; paralelamente, también envía a confeccionar casacas y monederos pequeños de los retazos, los cuales vende a personas conocidas. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Laredo” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100), con este dinero compró productos de belleza para tener stock y poder vender al crédito. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,200 (aproximadamente $402), el cual será pagado en seis meses, comprará productos de belleza de una nueva línea y además comprará cuero en pelo que actualmente está un poco escaso y por lo tanto más caro. La señora Esther sueña con construir su casa con todas las comodidades y con ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy beauty products. To buy cow hides.

loans.name: Edita Emerita

texts.es:
Edita is 43 years old, she completed primary school, she has 7 children of whom one is still dependent upon her. She lives in El Porvenir district in Trujillo province, La Libertad state.

Edita has been in business for a long time, she began her first business working in the mountains, selling animals such as young bulls; she would sell one per month and save her earnings. At that time she became part of the Community Bank but when she had a good amount of money saved she came to live in Trujillo and opened a shoe-making workshop. At the same time she joined with other neighbors and friends and formed the "Semillitas Creativas" (Creative Little Seeds) Community Bank. In this bank she obtained her first loan for 300 soles (approximately US$100) and purchased machinery for her shop.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 600 soles (approximately US$201), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy leather, glue and synthetic material to make shoes.

Edita dreams of having a well-stocked store in addition to her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Edita tiene 43 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales aun uno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad.

La señora Edita es comerciante desD. hace mucho tiempo, ella inició su negocio trabajando en la sierra, vendiendo animales como toritos (toros pequeños); vendía uno mensual e iba guardando su ganancia, desD. esa época formó parte D. un Banco Comunal D. la sierra pero cuando tuvo una buena cantidad D. dinero ahorrado se vino a vivir a Trujillo y puso un taller D. confección D. calzado, al mismo tiempo se juntó con otras vecinas y amigas y formó el Banco Comunal “Semillitas Creativas”. En este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 (aproximadamente $100) con los cuales completó para comprar maquinaria para su taller.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 600.00 (aproximadamente $201), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará cueros, pegamento y material sintético para fabricar el calzado.

La señora Edita sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida a parte D. su taller.

loans.use: Purchase leather, glue and synthetic material

loans.name: Nancy Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Nancy is 50 years old and has three children, all of which depend on her. She has only studied through grade school. She lives in a district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo of the Department of Liberty. Mrs. Nancy dedicates herself to the sale of food from her own home to people of her town. She gives out food to the workers of the various shoe shops in the area to whom she sells her food products. She is very happy because the credits she has received have enabled her to improve and expand her business.

Mrs. Nancy belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Cielo", from which she obtained her first loan of $100. With them she bought products in great quantities like oil, milk, noodles, pulp, and cookies. She uses these for the preparation of the food she sells.

She has just received a loan of $167 to repay in four months. With this money she has bought small benches in order to best accomodate her clients and she has also renovated the glass of her liquidator that was in bad condition. Mrs. Nancy dreams of having a big restaurant someday. She also wishes to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy tiene 50 años de edad, estudió solo primaria, tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Nancy se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa a personas de la zona pero además reparte comida a los trabajadores de diferentes talleres de calzados a quienes vende sus productos al crédito. Nos cuenta que antes de participar en su grupo mientras tanto vendía en menor cantidad ya que no tenía capital para realizar venta al crédito, ahora se siente muy contenta porque los créditos que ha recibido le han permitido crecer y mejorar su negocio.

La señora es socia fundadoras del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Cielo” en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) con ellos compró al por mayor productos que utiliza para la preparación de los alimentos que vende como: aceite, papa, fideo, leche y galletas.

Acaba de recibir un crédito de S/.500 (aproximadamente $ 167) para cancelarlos en 4 meses, con este dinero ha comprado banquitos para darle mayor comodidad a sus cliente y además ha renovado el vaso de su licuadora que estaba en mal estado. La señora Nancy sueña con tener un restaurante grande y con terminar de construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture (benches, seats) and repair of liquidator

loans.name: Chiara Group

texts.es:
The Chiara Community Bank was founded 6 months ago and has 16 partners.

Chiara is the name of the district where all the members come from and it is situated 1 hour away from the city of Ayacucho. Most of its population works on agriculture and their lands produce potatoes, corn, beans, wheat and vegetables.

Moreover, the members of the Community Bank breed small animals and cattle and at the Community Bank they are learning to be responsible, punctual and how to educate their children.

The women partners have different business like a groceries store, livestock breeding, dressmaking and selling meat and agricultural products. For instance, Maura, one of the partners, tailors regional clothes like aprons, white petticoats and tablecloth.

The women partners need different loan amounts, some are of 300 soles (100 usd), 600 soles (200 usd) or 900 soles (300usd), totaling 7500 soles (2500 usd) for the Chiara Community Bank as a whole.

The money will be invested purchasing rice, noodles, sugar cane, cigars, meat, cloth, animals and animal food.

The dreams of the partners are to have bigger business and to give their kids a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Chiara se inició hace 6 meses y tiene 16 socias, lleva el nombre del distrito D. donD. son todos los socios.

Chiara en un distrito que está a una hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y sus tierras producen papa, maíz, haba, trigo y verduras. Además los socias y socias D. este banco comunal se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y ganado.

En el Banco Comunal están aprendiendo a ser responsables, puntuales y a cómo educar a los hijos.

Las socias tienen diferentes negocios como tienda D. abarrotes, crianza D. animales, venta D. carne, agricultura, confección D. prendas D. vestir, engorD. D. vacuno. Como es el caso D. Maura que confecciona prendas D. vestir D. la zona como mandiles, fustanes y manteles.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 7500 soles D. préstamos para el Banco Comunal Chiara, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, fideo, caña, cigarro, carne, alimento para sus animales, telas, animales que benefician y venden.

Los sueños D. los socios es tener un negocio más granD. y dar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: The 16 partners of the Chiara Community Bank need different loan amounts of $100, $200 or $300, totaling $2500. The money will be invested purchasing rice, noodles, sugar cane, cigars, meat, cloth, livestock and animal food.

loans.name: Elisa Marcela

texts.es:
Elisa Marcela O. L. is 53 years old and was born in the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. She is a single mother of six grown children, and she has 2 grandchildren ages 2 and 4. Mrs. O. has more than 35 years of experience selling fruits and vegetables, and her clients are families, restaurant owners, grocery store managers, and public institutions that prefer her variety of fruits and vegetables. Mrs. O. needs to buy 200 units of bananas at $0.22 cents per unit, 100 units of cabbage at $1.44 dollars per unit, 2 boxes of tomatoes at $27.00 dollars per box, and 2 quintals (200 kilograms) of potatoes at $54 dollars per quintal (per 100 kilograms). With this loan she will be able to satisfy the demand of the public institutions and families that seek her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elisa Marcela O. L. tiene 53 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, a su cargo tiene 2 nietas de 2 y 4 años de edad. La Sra. O. tiene más de 35 años de experiencia vendiendo frutas y vegetales, sus clientes son los padres de familia, dueños de comedores, dueños de pulperías y las instituciones públicas que la prefieren por tener variedad de verduras y frutas. La Sra. O. necesita comprar 200 unidades de plátanos a $0.22 centavos dólar la unidad, 100 unidades de repollo a $ 1.44 dólar cada unidad de repollo, 2 cajas de tomates a $ 27.00 dólar cada caja y 2qq de papa a $54.00 dólar cada quintal, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de las instituciones públicas y los padres de familia.

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbage

payments.comment: La cuota real que pago es de $ 43.75 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 43.75 dólares.
La cuota real que pago es de $ 43.75 dólares.
LA CUOTA REAL DE PAGO ES DE $ 43.75 DÓLARES.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa is 41 years old, and she has only a fourth grade education because her father thought it sufficient that she know how to write her name since it was most important that she work in the field. She has four children who depend upon her. Carmen was born in San Ignacio, in the province of Cajamarca, and she lived with only her father and brothers because her mother abandoned the family when Carmen was a child. (It is only within the past five years that she has met her mother).

At the age of 14 Carmen fled from her house with some friends because her father was abusing her. She came to Trujillo to work as a maid, and at 16 became pregnant and had to leave her job (she has since married the child’s father). She then dedicated herself to washing clothes and later her sister-in-law gave her the idea of selling candy, and that’s how she started in this activity.

Currently she lives in the settlement “Ramón Castilla” of the district Huanchaco in Trujillo and she works selling candy during the school year at the entrance to a school located in the center of the city of Trujillo. During vacations and on the weekends she sells candy in the Plaza de Armas and also at the hotsprings of Huanchaco.

She obtained her first loan of S/300 (approximately $100) as part of the group Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” with which she purchased candy in order to stock her cart. Recently she has requested a loan from Manuela Ramos for S/700.00 (approximately $234) to be paid back in four months, with which she will buy some soft drinks and toys which she plans to sell during Christmas Vacation. Carmen Rosa dreams of having a stable business in a mall or market in order to not have to walk around selling her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, estudió solo hasta cuarto grado de primaria porque su padre consideró que era suficiente con que sepa escribir su nombre y que era más importante el trabajo en la chacra; tiene 4 hijos y todos dependen de ella. La señora Carmen Rosa es natural de San Ignacio, provincia del Departamento de Cajamarca, vivió solo con su padre y sus hermanos porque su madre los abandonó cuando era pequeña, dice haberla conocido recién hace cinco años. A la edad de 14 años huyó de su casa con unas amigas porque su padre la maltrataba y se vino a Trujillo a trabajar como empleada del hogar, a los 16 se embarazó del que es su esposo actualmente y tuvo que dejar el trabajo. Se dedicó entonces a lavar ropa ajena y posteriormente su cuñada le dio la idea de vender golosinas, es así como se inició en esta actividad. Actualmente vive en el Asentamiento Humano “Ramón Castilla” del Distrito de Huanchaco en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad y se dedica a vender golosinas en la puerta de un colegio ubicado en el centro de Trujillo, esto durante la época escolar, en la época de vacaciones y los fines de semana vende en la Plaza de Armas y también en el balneario de Huanchaco Obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” con el que compró golosinas para surtir su carrito. Recientemente ha obtenido un préstamo de Manuela Ramos S/.700.00 (aproximadamente $234) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, con los que compró algo de bebidas gaseosas y también juguetes, los que piensa vender durante las Fiestas Navideñas. La señora Carmen Rosa sueña con tener un negocio estable en algún centro comercial o mercado para dejar de ser ambulante.

loans.use: To purchase softdrinks and toys

loans.name: Nelly Olga

texts.es:
Olga is married, has 3 children and has been a member of the Lirio Community Bank for 3 years.

Olga sells automotive spare parts. She started this business 12 years ago renting a shop but this generated higher costs. She therefore decided to open the shop at her home but it did not have the right infrastructure. That is why she took a loan from the Community Bank and with it she built a roof on top of the house.

Now, Olga wants to further expand her business and she would like to enlarge her shop to sell more and open another spare parts shop as well.

Moreover, one month ago Olga bought a motorcycle that can be used as a taxi so her sons can work in their spare time. She requests a loan of 2400 soles (825 dls) which she will invest buying automotive spare parts like headlights, alternators and other plastic parts.

Olga learnt through her Community Bank to save, to have self-esteem and to better treat her clients. Her dreams are to see her sons learn a profession, to expand her spare parts business and to buy another motorcycle-taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga tiene 3 hijos, casada y es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio hace 3 años. Olga vende repuestos de carros y se inició en este negocio hace 12 años, en una tienda alquilada, la cual generaba mayores costos.

Por ello decidió abrir su negocio en su casa, la cual no estaba acondicionada pero posteriormente techó su casa con los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal. Olga quiere que su negocio crezca, ella tiene pensado abrir otra tienda de repuestos y ampliar su tienda para vender más.

Además hace un mes compró una mototaxi para que sus hijos puedan trabajar en sus horas libres. Su préstamo es de 2400 soles que lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos, faros, micas y alternadores.

En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, a tener autoestima y también cómo atender al cliente. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar otra mototaxi .

loans.use: Olga wants to further expand her spare parts shop buying more spare parts like headlights, alternators and other plastic parts

loans.name: Evemencia Severino

texts.en:
Evemencia is thirty-three years old and is a very active, hard-working businesswoman.  She and her husband have three children, two of them girls, who range from three to thirteen years old.

Evemencia sells an assortment of fashionable shoes and women’s clothing in her community.  Her store is very famous and people visit it every day to purchase her goods.  Currently she makes a monthly profit of $275.00.

She is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her inventory, especially for the holidays. She envisions continuing to grow, until it is one of the largest stores in the community.

loans.use: To increase inventory, especially for the holidays

loans.name: Margarita Prensa

texts.en:
Margarita, 30, defines herself as an experienced businesswoman.  She runs a general store which people visit every day to get goods such as rice, vegetable oil, onion and ripe fruits.  She and her husband have four children, two boys and two twin girls. 

Currently, Margarita sells from her house.  Her dream is to have her own local area in which to operate her business.

With her $600 loan (the second one obtained from our organization), Margarita will keep her inventory well-stocked so she is able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To keep inventory well-stocked

loans.name: Gabina Alicia

texts.es:
Gabina belongs to the Lirio Community Bank since 3 years. At her home, Gabina cooks and sells typical food from the region, like the “mondongo” and “puca picante”.

With this business, Gabina, who is a single mother, aims to cover all the needs of her 5 years old daughter.

Sometime ago, Gabina would only sell food on Saturdays and Sundays, now she sells it everyday of the week. She says that before she would sell the food in a very small place and that is why she decided to expand it and make it more welcoming.

Now that the place is bigger, Gabina wants her business to further expand by adding a groceries store.

With the 1000 soles (350 dls) Gabina requests, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, tuna and canned food.

Gabina says that through the Community Bank she learned to save, to have self-esteem and to better treat her clients. Her dreams are to see her daughter study to learn a profession and she would also like to build a house with solid materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabina pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio desde hace 3 años. Gabina se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas típicas de la región como “mondongo” y “puca picante”, negocio que realiza en su casa.

De esta forma Gabina, quien es madre soltera, espera sacar adelante a su hija de 5 años. Antes Gabina solo vendía su comida típica los sábados y domingos pero ahora vende todos los días.

Ella menciona que el ambiente donde vendía al inicio era pequeño, y que por ello decidió hacer un ambiente más cómodo y ahora cuenta con un local más grande. Ahora que tiene más espacio Gabina quiere que su negocio crezca implementando una tienda de abarrotes.

Entonces, con los 1000 soles Gabina invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo, atún y conservas. Gabina dice que en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, a tener autoestima y también a cómo atender al cliente.

Su sueño es que su hija estudie y sea profesional y también quisiera construir su casa con material noble.

loans.use: Gabina would like to expand her business adding a groceries store. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, tuna and canned food.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is young entrepreneur and mother of two boys.  Two years ago, Loida had opened a small cafeteria in her community, but she had to close it because she didn't have access to capital to get raw materials and other goods to run the business.

A few months ago, she took her first loan from FSMA to start up her cafeteria.  She got her old customers back and attracted new ones.  Now her business is beginning to flourish.

Loida is requesting a second loan of $375 to purchase more materials and foodstuffs, which will improve her cafeteria, attract more customers and help her raise her children in a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy needed materials for cafeteria business

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
I have been in the footwear business for more than 34 years. This business is the source of income for my family and I have dedicated my whole life to the making of leather shoes. Right now I lack the raw materials needed to fill some requests. I am asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars in order to buy raw materials for making shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 34 años que me dedico a la elaboración de calzado. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia y me he dedicado toda mi vida en la elaboración de calzado de piel. Pero me esta haciendo falta materia prima para elaborar unos pedidos que tengo y solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de materia prima, para la elaboración de calzado.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: B.sumi

texts.id:
Since the end of 2007 there were many programs/activities that necessitate the use of trumpet. Sumi saw this opportunity. He has been selling toys all this time. As this opportunity, occurring only once a year should be capitalized. As the profit from selling trumpet usually double when sold towards the end of the year. Sumi conduct this with help from his son, as her husband had since deceased. The toys and trumpet are sold in surrounding areas using motorcycle where the back is equipped with wooden racks stacked with toys and trumpets. Capital for this business was Rp. 800.000,00 (about USD85) can hopefully increase profits which currently is Rp. 30.000,00 (USD3) daily.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Menjelang akhir tahun 2007 tentu akan ada banyak acara yang memerlukan terompet. Sumi melihat peluang ini. Selama ini memang dia menekuni usaha Jual Mainan. Namun, peluang yang datangnya hanya setahun sekali tentu perlu disikapi sebijaksana mungkin. Karena hasil dari penjualan terompetnya bisa berlipat – lipat apabila dijual menjelang akhir tahun. Sumi menekuni usaha ini dibantu oleh anaknya. Sedangkan suaminya sudah meninggal. Mainan dan terompet – terompet tersebut dijual dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan sepeda motor yang bagian belakangnya sudah ditambahi dengan rak kayu tempat mainan dan terompet tersebut. Modal usaha Rp 800.000,00 diharapkan dapat meningkatkan keuntungannya yang selama ini Rp 30.000,00/hari.

loans.use: Purchase toys and materials for making trumpet (Membeli mainan dan bahan - bahan membuat terompet.)

loans.name: Mahli

texts.id:
Although he is not the only recycler in town, however he is still in this business. He understands what he has to do. One of it is to keep in touch with used items sellers - who sells used items to him. Every day he does selection of used items he bought from 07:00-11:00 AM, and evenings from 15:00-17:00 his wife is helping him. His weekly profit is about Rp450,000.00 (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Rental for 3 are land, and living expense are Rp20,000.00/day; and child's schooling expense is Rp 200,000.00/month. As his only source of income, Mahli like to expand this business for his family's future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun yang berprofesi sebagai pengepul barang bekas tidak hanya dia, namun Mahli tetap menekuni usaha ini. Dia memahami betul apa yang harus dia lakukan. Salah satunya adalah menjaga hubungan dengan para penjual barang bekas yang menjual barang – barang bekasnya kepada dirinya. Sehari – hari pekerjaannya adalah menyeleksi barang – barang yang dibelinya dari para penjual barang – barang bekas mulai pukul 07.00 – 11.00 dan sore mulai pukul 15.00 – 17.00 dibantu sang isteri. Keuntungan sebesar Rp 450.000,00 dia peroleh per minggunya. Biaya kontrak tanah 7 are, tiga orang anak, dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 200.000,00/bulan menjadi tanggungannya. Sebagai tumpuan usaha satu – satunya, Mahli ingin mengembangkan usaha ini demi masa depan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy used items

Membeli barang -barang bekas

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Although her husband has passed away, P. is not giving up. She is determined to run the Food chips business for their 3 children. Two has finished highschool, one is still in middle school. Daily living expense is about Rp 30,000.00 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp 9,000-9,500.00), and child schooling expense is about Rp100,000.00; not a small amount. Profit of Rp35,000 is certainly not sufficient. Not included in those large expenses are rental expenses of Rp180,000.00/month. The two children who finished highschool are helping her in the business. Loan of Rp1,000,000.00 she hoped could help her increase the sales volume of her food chips. Her rental room is also her business site. As a Food chips maker, S. has to provide kitchen utensils that would support her.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun suaminya sudah meninggal P. tidak putus asa. Dia bertekad menekuni usaha peyek demi 3 orang anaknya. Dua orang sudah tamat SLTA, seorang lagi masih duduk di bangku kelas 1 SLTP. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak per bulan Rp 100.000,00 bukan jumlah yang kecil. Keuntungan usaha Rp 35.000,00 tentu tidak mencukupi. Pengeluaran sebesar itu masih belum termasuk biaya kos Rp 180.000,00/bulan. Kedua anaknya yang sudah tamat SLTA bekerja untuk membantunya. Pinjaman sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00 dia harapkan dapat membantu menambah volume penjualan peyeknya. Rumah kosnya adalah tempat usahanya. Sebagai pengusaha peyek, S. perlu menyediakan peralatan dapur yang mendukungnya.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials to make Food chips

Membeli bahan - bahan untuk membuat peyek

loans.name: Selamet

texts.id:
With his motorcycle Selamet travels around to sell his items. He sells in Renon area. He bought his items in Badung market. Each week he bought with a capital of Rp 200,000.00 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Every day he could profit between Rp30,000.00-40,000.000. With his wife Selamet is runiing this business. He lives with his wife and one child in a rented house. They have no schooling expense, since their child is not going to school any more. However Selamet has to think about his family and child's future. He hopes the capital to be obtained could support them in running the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan sepeda motor yang dimilikinya Selamet berkeliling menjajakan barang dagangannya. Dia menjajakannya di daerah Renon. Barang – barang dagangannya dibeli di Pasar Badung. Dia melakukannya seminggu sekali dengan modal Rp 200.000,00. Per harinya dia memperoleh keuntungan antara Rp 30.000,00 – Rp 40.000,00. Bersama isteri Selamet menekuni usaha ini. Dia tinggal bersama isteri dan seorang anaknya di rumah kontrakkan. Biaya pendidikan anak sudah tidak ada karena anaknya sudah tidak sekolah. Namun Selamet tetap harus memikirkan masa depan anak dan keluarganya. Modal usaha yang dia dapatkan diharapkan dapat mendukung kelangsungan usahanya ini.

loans.use:
To add items for sale

Menambah jumlah barang dagangan yang dijual

loans.name: Omar

texts.id:
Omar's daily working hours started at 6:00-9:00 AM, then again 3:00-5:00PM. In between those times he used to sort the items he got, then to deliver them to the wholesaler. Places Omar visit includes garbage places, also shops to obtain used items by buying it, like empty cans, cartons, and items made from plastic. He does this recycling business with his wife. Profit obtained could reach Rp 500,000.00/month. (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp 9,000-9,500.00). Since 5 years Omar moved to Bali, and lives in Monang-Maning area. He likes to add used items to be sold to the wholesaler from the loan he hoped to obtian.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jam kerja Omar setiap harinya dimulai dari pukul 06.00 – 09.00. Kemudian dilanjutkan kembali pukul 03.00 – pukul 05.00. Jeda waktu di antaranya digunakan untuk menyeleksi barang – barang yang diperoleh untuk kemudian disetor ke pengepul. Tempat – tempat yang dikunjungi Omar adalah tempat sampah - tempat sampah. Selain itu ia juga ke toko – toko untuk mendapatkan barang – barang bekas di sana dengan membeli, seperti kaleng minuman, kardus dan barang – barang dari plastik. Usaha ini ia kerjakan bersama sang isteri. Keuntungan yang diperolehnya mencapai Rp 500.000,00 per bulan. Sejak 5 tahun yang lalu Omar pindah ke Bali dan menetap di kawasan Monang – Maning. Ia akan menambah barang – barang bekas yang dijual ke pengepul melalui pinjaman modal usaha yang dia peroleh..

loans.use:
To buy used items

Membeli barang - barang bekas

loans.name: Khikmatullo

texts.en:
Khikvatullo I. lives in Mastchoh, Tajikistan; he is married and has 4 children. Since 2006, Khikvatullo I. has been receiving and repaying loans from MicroInvest. The loan amounts have steadily increased, which shows the stability and development. of his business.

His business includes the milk processing and production of a variety of dairy products. His dream is to purchase a horn pedigree cow to produce more milk and sour-milk products to sell at the bazaars. He plans to produce a variety of milk and sour products, such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd.

Now Khikvatullo I. requests a loan of 1600 TJS (about $475) to purchase a pedigree milk cow. Purchasing this cow will allow him to significantly increase the family income and to plan the further expansion of his business and variety of dairy products.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree milk cows

loans.name: Khotam

texts.en:
Khotam K. lives in Mastchoh, Tajikistan. Khotam K. has been receiving and repaying loans of increasing amounts from MicroInvest since 2006. This shows that his business is stable and his income has increased.

He processes and produces milk products. He dreams of purchasing horn pedigree cattle to increase meat and milk-sour production to supply to the bazaars. He plans to produce a variety of milk and sour products, such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curd.

Khotam K. requests a loan of 1600 TJ (about $475) to purchase the pedigree milk cattle. This purchase will allow him to significantly increase his family's income and to plan the further expansion of his business and variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase a pedigree milk cow

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel M., bearer of BI#110020318W is 41 years old. He is a native of Maputo and currently resides in the Ndlavela district. He is married with 4 children. He sells coal in sacks. This is his second loan cycle in the program. The first loan was $210US and now he is asking for $425US for 6 months. He intends to use the money to grow his business.

Translated by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Manuel M. , Portador de BI nº110020318W, de 41 anos de idade , Natural de Maputo residente em maputo, no bairro de Ndlavela,Vive maritalmente com 4 filhos vende carvão em sacos esta no programa no 2º coclo no primeiro tomou 5000 agora vai tomar 10000 para pagar em 6 meses ,com o dinheiro pretente aumenta o seu negocio.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat Z. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 4 children. She has a shop in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar and sells food products, including tea and oil. She has a great variety of products, and repeat customers. She has been in this business for 21 years.

Working in Rokhy Abreshim bazaar, Rafoat Z. has stiff competition and that is why she wants to expand the variety of goods she offers for the New Year holiday purchases.

She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2006. Now she requests a loan of 3500 TJS (about $1025) to expand the variety of products that she offers.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Isabel Joaquim

texts.pt:
Isabel Joaquim G. is a resident of the Maxaquene district. She is 47 years old and has 5 children. She is married and has her business in her home. She is a seamstress and makes clothing for children. She is entering the program and asking for $225US for 4 months. She is going to invest the money in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Isabel Joaquim G. , portadora de BI nº110129024X ,residente do bairro da Maxaquene, de 47 anos de idade tem 5 filhos vive maritalmente tem o seu negocio em casa ,é modista faz roupa para crianças esta a entrar no programa e vai tomar 5000 para pagar em 4 meses o dinheiro ela vai investir no negocio.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Zacarias Alface

texts.pt:
Zacarias Alface B. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Mahotas. He has his business in the Magoanine market. He is married and lives with his 6 children. Zacarias joined the credit program in 2006 in a group, now he is requesting the loan individually. He requests 5000MT to be repaid in 6 months. He sells food products, and plans on using the loan to replenish his stock which he lost when he was robbed recently.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarias Alface B., portador do BI nº003038455,de 44 anos de idade residente no bairro das mahotas ,tem o seu negocio no mercado Magoanine, vive maritalmente, tem 6 filhos , entrou no programa em 2006 como elemento do grupo agora vai tomar sozinho o emprestimo no valor de 5000 para pagar em 4 meses vende produtos almentares deversos, com o dinheiro pretende aplicar na sua banca visto que ele sofreu um roubo para poder se manter precisa desse dinheiro.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Carlos Cipriano

texts.pt:
Carlos Cipriano E. lives in the neighborhood of Matola. He is single and teaches at Matola School. He is in the 3rd phase of the credit program. His first loan was of 3.000MT and is now requesting a loan of 7000MT to buy land.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

carlos Cipriano E. , portador do passaporte nº351501 , residente no bairro da matola, solteiro e da aulas na escola Matola sede esta no 3º ciclo entrou no programa no dia 07/03/07 tomando o valor de3000 agora vai tomar 7000 para compra de bens moveis é professor.

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Amélia Luís

texts.pt:
Amélia Luís D. is 45 years old. She is single and lives in the neighborhood of Polana Caniço in Maputo. She sells basic groceries such as rice, corn flour, peanuts, beans and cooking oil from her front yard. She is new to the credit program. She is requesting a loan of 6.000MT to be repaid 4 months. She will use the funds to buy more products for her stand.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Amélia Luís D. tem 45 anos de idade, é solteira e vive no bairro Polana Caniço em Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade em frente à sua residência como arroz, farinha de milho, amendoim, feijão, óleo, entre outros. É nova no programa e não pareceu ser de mau carácter. Vai tomar um empréstimo de 6.000MT para pagar em 4 meses, com vista ao reforço do stock do seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mr. Mohamed Samari is 28 years old, married and has four children. He has been the owner of a small grocery store for five years and manages it well. This store enables the people in his village to buy food supplies. He buys the products in Kpalimé, which is 30km from Adéta. He has a very large customer base. To satisfy customer demand, Mr. Samari would like a loan to increase his supply of merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Samari Mohamed est agé de 28 ans , marié et père de 04 enfants . Il est propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 5 ans et la gère convenablement. Cette boutique permet à la population de son village de s'approvisionner en produit de consommation. Il achète les produits à kpalimé, localité située à 30 KLM d'Adéta. Il a une clientelle très importante .Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Mr Samari souhait un emprunt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises

loans.use: To buy 10 cases of milk, 15 bags of rice, 8 bags of sugar and 10 cases of canned food in Lomé to sell in Adéta

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.en: Lutfy M. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan; she is married and has 4 children. She has been a serious and committed client of MicroInvest since 2007. Because of her credit record, she is eligible for larger loans.  Mrs. M. is a very skilled in business. She has a shop in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar where she sells foodstuffs such as cheese, condensed milk, meat, buttermilk, and cottage cheese. She offers a wide assortment of goods and has repeat customers. She has been in this business for 20 years. Working in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar, she has stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. She is asking for a loan of $475 to increase the variety of products that she sells. This loan will help her to develop the existing business and to plan further improvements.

loans.use: To expand the line of products she sells in her grocery

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim S. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. He has a business selling goods such as batteries, lamps, and lanterns. Nasim works in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar. He has a large assortment of goods, but he has many competitors in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar.

Nasim has been a responsible client of MicroInvest for the past year. He requests a loan so he can increase his current supply of goods and expand his inventory, so he can successfully compete in the bazaar.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety of products to sell

loans.name: Abdurakhim

texts.en:
Abdurakhim D. lives in B.Gafurov. He has a shop in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar where he sells meat products, such as salami, sausages, and other meat products. He has a wide variety of products and repeat customers. He has stiff competition in the bazaar, so he wants to increase the variety of products that he offers.

Abdurakhim D. became a client of MicroInvest in 2007. Now he requests a loan of 1600 TJS (about $475) to increase the variety of goods in his shop.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of meat products to sell

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra Kpédzokou is 48 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom are at school. She is the owner of a small shop in Assahoun, located 70km from Kpalimé, that sells printed fabric. She has 15 years’experience in the business and is a fine woman. Since her husband retired five years ago, she has become the head of the household in terms of taking care of all the household expenses and her children’s schooling. She buys her goods in Lomé and sells them in Assahoun.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Abra Kpédzokou est agée de 48 ans mariée et mère de 04 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de tissu imprimé installée à Assahoun localité située à 70 KLM de Kpalimé. Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans le secteur et est une brave femme . Son mari étant en retraite depuis 5 ans elle est devenue la responsable du foyer en matière du financement des charges du foyer et de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle achete les marchandises à Lomé et les revend à Assahoun

loans.use: To buy printed fabric in Lomé to sell in Assahoun

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira lives with her big family (7 children and husband) in Istaravshan,Tadjikistan, and works in a local food market. She sells qurut, a hand-made milk product. The production of this kind of food includes several steps. First, milk is boiled to make yogurt, then the yogurt is squeezed until it becomes thick cream. After adding salt, the next part of the process it to form little balls of different sizes by hand, and then dry the balls under the sun. The finished product is a milk product in high demand among the populations of Central Asia.

Zamira said that it was her granny's business and when she was a child she helped to make it. As part of the USSR, Zamira worked at a factory. She did not imagine that her granny's business could help her support her family during an economic crisis in Tadjikisatan.

Today she has many customers because she has engaged in this business for over 10 years. All her children learned this business as they help her to prepare qurut every day. She requests a loan from Kiva so she can purchase more milk to increase her current business.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of qurut (a milk product) to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
M. Mahbuba is en experienced business woman, who has been in business for over 13 years. Her son Shafiev Hurshed is her salesman (pictured). She exports her goods from Karosy, Kirgizistan.

In 2005 she was a member of the Bahridin group, who received a loan from MicroInvest. Later, she received the maximum loan as an individual so she could expand her own business.

Currently, she purchases the goods, and her son sells them at the market place. This summer she spent a big part of her working capital for son's wedding. That is why she requests an additional loan to support their current business and purchase more fabrics and headscarves to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more fabrics and headscarves

loans.name: Amir Din

texts.en:
Amir Din is married and lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan with his family. Amir is uneducated but he is a well-established farmer who has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Amir is happy from his work but would like to expand his business. Thus, he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary materials to cultivate all his land, therefore, making good income for his family. He extends his gratitude to AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his necessary raw materials

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir has been in business for over 15 years. He is married and has 3 children. His business place is located in the central market in Istaravshan, Tajikistan.

He is an engineer, but after the collapse of the government, he tried for two years to find a job with a good salary so he could meet the needs of his family. His friend helped him rent one little trading place in the market and he started to sell seeds of different kind of leguminous plants. He made very little profit because he had limited money.

When Nasir heard about Microinvest, he became a client and used his first loan to purchase seeds in lots. It was a first step in expanding his business. Today he offers a wide assortment of seeds and also he has many customers.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva so he can purchase a large batch of seeds while the price is lower because it is the season of gathering the harvest from the fields.

loans.use: Increasing the quantity of seeds to sell

loans.name: Hadayat Allah

texts.en:
Hadayat Allah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan and is married, living with his own family. He runs a dress shop that he has operated since 2002 in Kabul.

Hadayat has a number of good clients today. He wants to further expand his business so he wishes to take an individual loan to buy new kinds of dress to make a better income to help his family. At home, he is very happy with his family.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of dresses

loans.name: Bustonbek

texts.en:
Bustonbek owns a little shop in Istaravshan, Tadjikistan. He is a doctor and works at hospital, but his salary is not enough to meet his family's needs. So he rented the space for a shop, where he sells different kinds of goods, such as perfumes, toys, and household goods. He tries to make his shop attractable for clients and more competitive than other shops in the Shahristan central market, in one of the districts in Khujand, Tajikistan.

He buys his goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market and makes a good profit. For the coming New Year, he wants to purchase holiday goods, and he is requesting a loan of 1000 TJS (about $300).

loans.use: Purchase  New Year holiday items to sell

loans.name: Zinllah Bodin

texts.en:
Zinllah Bodin lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his own family.

Zinllah has a retail shop that he started when he was just a small boy . Now, he wants to expand his business. Thus, he would like to take an individual loan to buy extra materials such as baskets, shampoo and powder to make a better income and create a brighter future for himself as well as for his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, shampoo and powder

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 33 year old father of 3 who ives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Hussein is a butcher and supports his entire family with the income earned from his butcher store business. This is the second time Hussein is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs the loan to buy provisions for his business. Hussein is an honest and hardworking man and can be relied upon to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his butcher shop

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat has been buying and selling household goods for over 5 years. She is married and has 3 children, and her business provides the only steady income for the family. Also, her brother helps her in her business.

From the beginning, she bought goods from suppliers and sold retail. A loan from Microinvest gave her the opportunity to purchase lots of goods, and make a good profit. She requests an additional loan through Kiva so she can purchase a variety of copper containers, such as teapots, watering cans, and containers of different sizes, to sell.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of copper goods to sell

loans.name: Angele

texts.en: B. Angèle is 59 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are not able to care to her, so she sells various food and aroma products to care to herself. Angèle lives in Yopougon, a populated suburb in the north of the Abidjan District. She has been doing this business for many years and has been able to built a small house for herself. Angèle heard about the AE&I microcredit program from her cousin in July 2005 and she got her first loan from the Institution three months later. She has been an excellent performer since then, and plans to continue growing her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her inventory

loans.name: Ebadan

texts.en: C. is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. A member of LAPO for the past three years, she earns income selling kitchen utensils, gift items, and recharge cards. C. needs a loan of US$875 to buy more recharge card for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of recharge cards for sale

loans.name: Gavkhar

texts.en:
Gavkhar M. lives in Chkalovsk, Tajikistan; she is married and has 2 children. She has a supermarket in the bazaar in Ainy Park. She has a wide assortment of goods, and repeat customers. She has been in this business for 15 years. She wants to expand her business and open a new market.

Gavkhar M. has received loans of increasing amounts from MicroInvest since 2006. Her business is stable and income keeps increasing. Now she requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to fund opening the new market.

loans.use: Fund opening a new supermarket

loans.name: Mukhayo

texts.en:
Mukhayo B. lives in D. Kholmatov Tajikistan; she is married and has 5 children. She has a mini-market where she offers a variety of goods, including meat products, liquor goods, cheese, sweats, pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curd.

Mukhayo B. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006, and she has a stable business. Now she requests a loan of 2300 TJS (about $675) so she can increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Mr. Friday O. is 50 years old, married, with 7 children. He lives in Uromi, Edo state, and owns a poultry business. He has been a member of LAPO since 2005 and would be thankful for a loan of US$550 to buy more food for his birds.

loans.use: Purchase of feedstock for a poultry business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a single 23 year old man who lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. He owns a grocery shop and needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business. Hussein is an independent and ambitious young man. He is determined to stand on his own feet and to help provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Ziyafet

texts.en:
Ziyafet V. is from the Jorat settlement of Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is busy with trading a small variety of industry goods and different sort of retail things. She began her business with $200 in 2003. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she cannot earn enough money to meet her family's important consumption needs. She wants to rent a space in the trading area in the central market and increase the assortment of her retail trade. She has already gathered some money for it. But it is not enough, so she needs to borrow money.
Ziyafet needs $300 for expanding her business. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She believes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.en: Diomandé Fatoumata is a 43-year-old dynamic and ambitious woman. She lives with her husband and their two children in Yopougon-Sideci, in the north of the Abidjan district. Her eldest boy will finsih primary school next year, and her younger kid is in the 3rd class in primary school. Her husband is a truck driver at the Ministry of Agriculture. He travels a lot so that Fatoumata is left alone with the children a good deal of the time. Fatoumata owns a cosmetic products store in Sideci market where she sells various fashion products that are very much in demand by her customers. With the revenue she earns from this business, she cares for her children and contributes to household and education expenses. Fatoumata is an excellent performer.

loans.use: To purchase goods and replenish stock

loans.name: Gulnare

texts.en:
Gulnare I. is from the Jorat settlement in Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She began her business with $150 in 2002. She is busy with mobile industry goods, plates, electrical equipment and different retail things.  With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she can hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.
Gulnare needs $300 for expanding her business. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She believes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45 year old father of 6 who lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ali owns a van which he uses for all kinds of transportation. Ali is depending on this business to provide for his family. Ali is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his van, which needs to be fixed in order to continue to run efficiently.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance costs of his van

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram Mamedov is 41 years old. He is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He is married and the father of two children. He lives with his parents. His parents are old. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He began his business with $200 in 2002. He works in the café situated in the Sumgayit. He wants to expand his business, so he would like to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his cafe. He had already gathered some money for it. But it is not enough, so he needs to borrow money.
Bayram would like to receive a $500 loan in order to repair his cafe and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living condition of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to repair his cafe and to buy necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat F. lives in the B.Gafurov region in Tajikistan. He processes meat and milk products, which he sells in the bazaars. He dreams of purchasing the pedigree horn cattle to increase the meat and milk products. He plans to increase the variety of products, such as meat products, pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curd.

Shavkat F. became a client of MicroInvest in 2007, and has a stable business. Now he requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to purchase the pedigree milk cows, which would allow him to significantly increase the variety of products he sells, and his family's income.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree milk cows

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 33 years old  and lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ali is a car mechanic who repairs cars in the neighborhood. Ali is requesting a loan to purchase materials for his business and is determined to sustain and continuously develop the business.

loans.use: To purchase material for auto repairs

loans.name: Hacixanim

texts.en:
S. Hacixanim is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 46 years old and lives in Sumgayit city in the north-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic. She is married and has two children. She is busy with selling mobile industry goods and equipment, retail trade.  She began her business 3 years ago and it has allowed her to support her family. With this business, she could earn some money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs.
S. needs $300 for expanding her business. She will increase the assortment of industry goods and buy additional kinds of goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of goods

loans.name: Okhuelegbe

texts.en: D. is 38 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. For the past fifteen years he has been earning income as a carpenter. He has been a LAPO member for three years and now needs a loan of US$875 to buy wood and other materials for making furniture in his store.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and other materials needed for carpentry

loans.name: Terane

texts.en:
Terane A. is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She began her business with $200 in 2002. She is busy with mobile industry goods, retail trade. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.
Terane needs $400 for expanding her business. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of the industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya R. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan; she is married and has 4 children. She has a clothing shop in the Panjshanbe bazaar where she sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. Roziya R. has a variety of clothing, and repeat customers, but she wants to import the new fashions demanded by the population today.

Roziya R. has been a dependable client of MicroInvest since 2006. She now requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to increase the variety of clothing that she offers for sale.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Gita

texts.en: Mrs. Gita R., 30 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband and a son. Mrs. R.'s husband, Mr. Om Shankar R., works in a private office and her son is in primary school. Only the income of her husband is not enough to fulfill the needs of the family. So Mrs. R. opened a cosmetics shop 2 years ago. She sells different varities of cosmetics goods in her shop such as churi (glass bangles), creams, and powders. Now she seeks a loan to buy cosmetics goods in order to expand her business. She wants to help her husband by fulfilling the family needs, and she also wants to save some money to provide better education to her only son.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Naime

texts.en: Naime is a 64 year old grandmother who lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Naime owns a grocery shop and is requesting $1,200, her  fifth loan from Al Majmoua, to buy merchandise for the store. Naime is a remarkable woman, a widow who is raising her grandson because his mother died. Naime is striving on her own  to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 33 year old man who lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Hassan owns a grocery store  and is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy merchandise for the store to sustain it and to continuously develop it. Hassan is known to be a very self reliant and dependable micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs.Goma S., 49 years old, lives in Tangal. Tangal is located nearby the famous market, Mangar Bazaar, of Lalitpur district of Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this area are engaged in traditional work. She has eight members in her family including herself. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Gopal, is a retired government officer. Her older son works in a traveling agency and younger son works in a shop. Her daughter is studying in grade 11 and her granddaughter is in primary school.
Mrs. S. opened small hotel 2 years ago. In her hotel she sells newari food. Newari food is very popular in Kathmandu Valley because the majority of the people in this area are Newars. Now she seeks a loan to buy goods such as food grains, vegetables and others in order to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to change their standard of living and also provide better educations to her daughter and granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Faig

texts.en:
Faig Mehraliyev is 44 years old. He is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Right now he lives in Sumgayit with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He works in the café situated in the central market. He began his business 5 years ago. 
He wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his café. He has already gathered some money for repair work. But it is not enough, so he needs borrow money.
Faig would like to receive a $300 loan in order to repair his café and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living condition of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipments for his café

loans.name: Tina Henriette

texts.en: Koré Tina Henriette is a 30-year-old single mother. She has three children and lives with them in her big brother's house in Yogougon-Sideci, in the north of Abidjan. She has sold plantains and cassava since she was 12 years old. Tina's elder child is in secondary school, and the younger children are both in elementary school. Tina's plantains and cassava business is her sole revenue resource from which she pays household and education expenses. Tina is very courageous and faced a difficult situation when she was left alone to care for her children. She has been able to send all her children to school. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 so she can increase her stock and begin to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more produce

loans.name: Santi

texts.en: Mrs. Santi D., 30 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint family with her mother-in law, her husband, one daughter and one son. Her daughter and son are studying in grade 10 and 5 respectively. Her Husband, Mr. Sanu Babu D., has no work. So the condition of their family is very miserable. They can't even fulfill their needs of the family. So to overcome their family problem they opened their grocery shop 4 years ago in their own house. All members of her family equally contributed in that shop. They work hard to earn more. Because of hard work, their family condition is improving. Now Mrs. D. is asking for her first loan to invest in her shop. With this amount she will buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Boyukxanim

texts.en: Boyukxanim M. is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 49, married with three children and lives in the city of Sumgayit the east area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Boyukxanim is busy with mobile industry goods trading. She cannot develop her business, because she has no collateral to get a loan from commercial banks. That is why she applied for a $300 loan. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds retail goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She believes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 41 years old, married, and has 12 children. Since 2004, she has been earning money selling provisions, drinks and food. Gloria has been a member of LAPO for the last three years and now needs a loan of US$875 to buy more provision for her store.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions for a store

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en: Mrs. Sanu M., 35 years old,  lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, Mr. Ashakaji M., one son and one daughter. Her husband is a driver in a private company. Her son left school and also he has no work. Her daughter is studying in grade 3. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop 4 years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good so they can't provide a better education for her daughter because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. To overcome this problem she opened a grocery shop. Due to lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop. So she is asking for her first loan to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, etc. She needs to spend her income to provide better education for her daughter, and she wishes to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her work

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Maiya S., a resident of Wolkhu, Lalitpur, lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Mrs. S.’s older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 11. Her daughter works in a department store. Mrs. S. and her husband, Mr. Barja Ram S., are engaged in their own business. They make papads, colorful chips, and other varities of snacks in their own home, and have for eight years. They sell their products in grocery shops. They want to buy more raw materials for preparation of snacks. As they have good experience in their business, their snacks items are very popular among the people. Mrs. S. is requesting her third loan to buy food materials for their work.

loans.use: To buy foods and materials for her work

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a 41 year old father of 3 who lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Kamal owns a pharmacy which is the main source of income for his family. He needs a loan to buy more merchandise for the store. This will be  Kamal's 7th loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Mrs. Salima G., 29 years old, is a resident of Baghdol. Baghdol is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small business activities. Mrs. G. lives with her husband. Mrs. G. and her husband, Mr. Shyam Bahadur G., opened the grocery shop two years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, paddy, and bitten rice. Due to lack of money they cannot expand their business. So she seeks a loan to buy necessary goods like noodles, biscuits and others various grocery goods, to invest in their business and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo K. is 40, married, and the mother of two children.She has owned a little general store for more than 5 years. Her husband is polygamous and manages to just get by. The income from Adzo's business allows her to pay the school fees for her children as well as covering the simple needs of her family.

Adzo is good at running her business and has a devoted and steadily growing clientele. She is hoping to use the requested loan to diversify her inventory so as to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Adzo K. est agée de quarante ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire de boutique d'alimentation générale depuis plus de 5 ans . Son mari est poligame et se débrouille dans la vie. Le revenu de son activité lui permet de scolariser ses enfants et de financer les besoins élémentaires du foyer. Elle maîtrise bien son activité et a une clientèle fidèle et en pleine croissance. Elle désire avec ce crédit diversier la vente de son stock afin de satisfaire la clientèle

loans.use:
purchasing food items in Lomé for re-sale in Kpalimé

Achat des produits alimentaires à Lomé pour les revendre à Kpalimé

loans.name: Janu Kumari

texts.en: Janu Kumari R. lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. She lives in Bholdhoka of Lalitpur district. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and the younger son is in grade 5. Her daughter is studying in grade 4. Her husband, Mr. Shiva R., is a laborer in house construction work. Mrs. R. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making ladies' dresses. She prefers to make popular dress styles like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. R. took a 4-month training course in tailoring. Now she seeks a loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work like cloth, string and a cutting machine.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells clothing and shoes - she has been in this business since 2004. She is 29 years old and has four children. Felicia would be thankful for a loan of US$450 to be able to buy more clothing and shoes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Ganu Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Ganu Maiya M., 36 yearsold, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint  family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband and two sons. Her sons are studying in grade 10 and 6 respectively. Her husband Mr. Dharma M. and she make traditional brass religious statues. In Nepal, brass religious statue-making work is very famous and the demand is also increasing. So she seeks loan money to buy raw materials like wax, silver, etc. to make brass religious statues to fulfill the demand of statues.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Anju

texts.en: Mrs. Anju T., 50 yrs old, resides in Nakhu Tole. Nakhu is a village situated in the Lalitpur district. Almost all of the people around are envolved in local businesses. Mrs.T. has three members in her family including her. She has one son who is 21 yrs old and is studying in his second year of school (post-high-school). Her husband's name is Roshan T.. They do vegetable farming and even sell flowers. They need the loan of in order to buy the necessary things for growing vegetables like seeds, manure and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy necessary things for growing vegetables

loans.name: Chiri

texts.en: Mrs Chiri M., 33 yrs old, is a  woman residing in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is a village situated within the Lalitpur district. Most of the people around here are involved in agriculture. Mrs Chiri M. has 4 members in her family including herself. Her husband is Prakash M.. He is a civil servant. She has two sons. The elder son is 13 yrs old, studying in grade 6, whereas the younger son is 7 yrs old, studying in grade 2. Mrs M. is doing goat farming. She sells goats on a contract basis and earns money for her family. She needs loan to buy more kid goats and necessary food for these.

loans.use: To buy more kid goats

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi S., 40 years old, is married and the mother of 4 children. For the last 10 years she has managed a little roadside restaurant for students and various passerby. She contributes to the financing of the household with the income from her business. Essi Séna wants to improve the environment of her restaurant by building a more attractive and cleaner setting to make her customers more comfortable.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

S. ESSI est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et agée de 40 ans. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle gère un petit restaurant au bord de la route pour les élèves et divers passants. Elle contribue au financement du foyer avec le revenu de son activité. Séna Essi veut améliorer l'environnement de son restaurant par la construction d'un cadre plus attraiyant et propre afin de rendre plus à l'aise sa clientèle
