loans.use: Essi wants to enlarge her restaurant with her loan

loans.name: Osborn

texts.en: Osborn is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Since 1992, he has been repairing and selling used electronic equipment. Osborn needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more used electronics for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of used electronics for sale

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en: Mrs. Sanu M. is 24 years old and resides in Thecho. Thecho lies within The Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this locality are engaged in agriculture such as poultry farming. Mrs. M. has 4 members in her family including herself. Her husband's name is Sanu Kaji M.. He has gone abroad in Dubai to work. She has two daughters. The elder daughter is studying in the 7th grade class and the younger is studying in the 2nd grade class. She is engaged in poultry farming. She sells hens, cocks and even eggs in the market. She needs a loan in order to buy necessary things like medicine for the hens and even corn and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy necessary things like medicine for hens and even corn and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ayemere

texts.en: Ayemere is 42 years old, married, and has two children. He is an electrician who wires houses as well as sells electrical materials. Ayemere needs a loan of US$875 to buy more materials for sale, and believes that the money would also allow him to better serve his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of more electrical materials for sale

loans.name: Ojiefoh

texts.en: Ojiefoh T. is 32 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. For the past ten years he has been involved in the photography and video coverage business.  Ojiefoh would be thankful for a loan of US$875 to be able to buy a video camera for his business.

loans.use: Purchase of a video camera

loans.name: Amenan

texts.en: K. Amenan is 40 years old, and has six children. Her husband is a farm worker in Gagnoa, 160 miles from Abidjan. She sells spices, eggplants, okra and various vegetables in Yopougon market, in the north of the Abidjan district. Amenan is the main revenue provider for her family. She provides pays the main household and education expenses as her husband only receives seasonal incomes. Amenan heard about AE&I two years ago from her sister and has got different micro loans that she has reimbursed in a very good manner. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 so she can purchase more produce and supply more customers.

loans.use: To purchase produce and increase sales

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 26 year old father who lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Khaled is a car electrician. He is requesting $1,000, his fourth loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy the materials he needs for his auto repair business. Khaled is known to be an ambitious, responsible and self-reliant young man. He is determined to provide for his family and to offer them the financial security they need.

loans.use: To buy materials for his auto repair business

loans.name: Akissi Kouakou

texts.en: Mrs. H. Epse Kouakou Akissi is a dynamic and brave 54-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. Her eldest daughter is married, and the youngest has just completed his Accounting diploma. She lives with her family in Yopougon-Sideci, a suburb in the north of the Abidjan disctrict. Mrs. H. has sold smoked fish and frozen meat (pork leg) for many years, in the Yogougon-Sideci market. She purchases fresh fish from fishermen early in the morning every day. She then smokes and grills the fish before selling it. This business allows H. to take care family household and education expenses for the children. Her husband is retired from the public transportation company. Mrs H. is also the President of the cooperative of micro businesswomen of Yopougon-Sideci. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 so she can increase the volume of fish she buys and sells.

loans.use: To purchase fish from fishermen

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 26 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria. He earns money selling and repairing refrigerators. John would be greatful for a loan of US$700 to buy a bike, which will allow him to reach out to more customers and serve as a general means of transportation.

loans.use: Purchase of a bike

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria. Josephine earns money selling food and drinks. She has been in the business for 2 years and now would be thankful for a loan of US$875 to buy more provisions and a grinding machine.

loans.use: Purchase of more provisions and a grinding machine

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia is 31 years old  and lives in the Bekaa with her husband, who suffers from a physical handicap. Hadia owns a grocery shop which is the main source of income for her family. She  is requesting a loan with which to buy merchandise for her store. This is the second time Hadia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 42 year old father of 6 who lives with his family of 8 (himself, his wife and their 6 children) in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. He sells cigarettes in the neighborhood. He is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise for his store so that he can earn enough to continue paying his children's school fees. Mohamad is determined to support his large family.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a very caring and considerate 34 year old father. 2 of his children have speech difficulties and require speciA. attention. Khalil lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon, where he operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. This is the second time Khalil is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua. He intends to use the loan to buy new merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. Esther earns her income selling onions and pepper, and has been in this business since 1997. She is asking for a loan of US$450 to buy more onions and pepper for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of onions and pepper

loans.name: Wiam

texts.en: Wiam is 21 years old and lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Wiam is an independent person who is determined to help his family by earning an income. He owns a grocery shop and is seeking his second loan from Al Majmoua to buy new merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is 37 years old  and owns an accessories and perfume store in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. She is an independent, self-reliant and confident person. She and her fiance are building a home for themselves. This loan is Souad's third from Al Majmoua-- she will use the loan to purchase new merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A., 39 years old, is married and has 8 children. She owns a poultry farm and is a member of LAPO in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. She has been in the poultry business for four years, and now needs a loan of US$700 to buy feedstock and more chicks for rearing.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks for rearing

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en: Ramez is 32 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ramez rears and breeds animals and needs a loan to increase his animal livestock. Ramez loves his work and enjoys working in a natural environment. He is his household's sole provider and is known to be an independent and reliable person.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34 year old father of 3 who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon with his family. He owns a grocery store and wants his store to do well so that he can provide his family with the best life possible. This $700 loan is Ali's fifth loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy new merchandise for his store.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Badih

texts.en: Badih is a carpenter. He lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon and has 8 children. Badih loves his work  and, being very talented with carpentry, his work is much appreciated in the community. He is requesting $1,200, his second loan from A. Majmoua, to buy carpentry materiA..

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Mrs. Ines lives in her own house with her husband and sons on December 14Th Street in the Alto Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. She has previously obtained a loan through Kiva which she totally repaid. She used the money to increase her working capital. Ines makes wool blankets from Vicuna and Alpaca. In the mornings and part of the afternoons she spins the wool using wooden staffs. She works together with another lady who is in charge of the knitting. They divide the profits between them.

She is now requesting a loan to buy a wool spinning machine. Spinning manually is very tiring and she cannot fulfill all the outstanding orders.

Her credit history makes her eligible for a new loan. Her repayment history is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ines vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle 14 de diciembre de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella ya obtuvo un primer crédito a través de Kiva, el anterior fue cancelado en su totalidad y sirvió para aumento de su capital de trabajo; Ines se dedica a la elaboración de mantas de Vicuña y Alpaca durante la mañana y parte de la tarde ella hila en ruecas de madera y trabaja con una señora que es la que se encarga de tejer con la cual divide las ganancias.

El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar una maquina de hilar ya que manualmente se cansa mucho y no alcanza a cubrir los pedidos que le hacen.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, pues su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Purchase of wool spinning machine

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German lives in his own house with his wife on Antofagasta Street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. He is 63 years old and since he was young, he has been making sweaters. He works together with his wife, who is in charge of sales.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of yarn and other materials needed for the finished product. This business supports both of them; they can cover the loan payments and also their personal needs.

Their credit history makes them eligible for a new loan. They are considered preferred customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

German vive en casa propia con su esposa en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 63 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la confección de chompas, trabaja junto con su esposa que es la encargada de las ventas.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar lana y otros materiales que son necesarios para el acabado final. Con esta actividad se mantienen ambos y pueden cubrir las cuotas del préstamo así como también sus necesidades personales.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que se considera cliente preferencial.

loans.use: Purchase of yarn and materials

loans.name: Juan C.

texts.es:
Juan lives in his own house with his wife and sons on Valentin Abecia Street in the San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz. He has an auto repair shop in the same neighborhood. He works there himself with two other employees who he pays weekly. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of additional tools and the expansion of his shop, which will generate more business.

He has been a client of Impro since 2006. His credit history is good and allows him to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Valentín Abecia de la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; él tiene un taller de mecánica en la misma zona, en el mismo trabaja con dos empleados a los cuales les paga semanalmente; el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas herramientas y poder agrandar el taller, por ser una fuente generadora de empleo.

Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el año 2006; su historial es bueno y le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan lives with his parents and younger son in Emilio Calderon Street, city of La Paz. He paints landscapes and movie posters. Based on the kinds of paintings that he does, he is seen as a very popular painter who earns a living through his art. The credit he wants is for the purchase of materials so that he can make more paintintgs and then mount them on special wooden frames and glass. This way he can increase the value of them and improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo menor en la calle Emilio Calderón de la zona Belén de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el arte de pintar paisajes además de elaborar carteles para los cines; por el tipo de pinturas que realiza, Juan puede ser catalogado como un pintor popular que se gana la vida a través de su arte. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder elaborar mas cuadros pero con marcos de madera especial y vidrio para que adquieran mas valor y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene crédito con Impro, pero su actividad emprendedora lo califica como sujeto de crédito dentro de nuestra visión social y consiguientemente sugerimos concederle una oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his paintings

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rufina lives in her own home with her husband and children in a small town of La Paz city. She makes skirts with her husband's help; this activity has supported her for more than ten years and its her only form of income. It is also the only way for them to support their family. The credit she wishes for is to purchase materials necessary to make these beautiful skirts. She will then sell them and increase her income. She's a former client of Kiva and based on her credit history she was able to get another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rufina vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle junta vecinal de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la confección de polleras con la ayuda de su esposo; esta actividad la mantienen por mas de diez años y es su único medio para percibir ingresos y cubrir la mantención de su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder realizar diferentes modelos de polleras (polleras son faldas – skirts in english – que usan las cholas y campesinas en Bolivia) para vender a mejor precio y aumentar sus ganancias. Es cliente antiguo y por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and materials to make local skirts

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Mr. Celso R. lives with his wife in his own home in the San Pedro neighborhood in the city of La Paz. Mr. R. works as an urban taxi driver. The vehicle which he uses for work is deteriorating due to its age and the constant repairs that it needs are impeding his ability to work normally. The loan would be used to buy a used vehicle that is worth $2,500, of which IMPRO is financing $1,475 with their own funds, so he is requesting a loan for the remainder of the amount through KIVA. This is the tenth time that he requests a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him to receive a loan. It is worth mentioning that the previous loans were paid back within their established terms without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Celso R. vive en casa propia en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, el señor Celso trabaja como chofer de taxi urbano. El vehiculo con el que trabaja esta deteriorado por su antigüedad y las constantes reparaciones que necesita impiden que pueda realizar su trabajo con normalidad. El crédito solicitado será destinado como parte de la compra de un vehiculo a medio uso. El valor total del vehiculo es de $2,500 de los cuales IMPRO está financiando $1,475 con fondos propios y la diferencia está siendo solicitada a través de KIVA. Esta es la décima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Cabe mencionar que los préstamos anteriores fueron cancelados en sus plazos establecidos sin problema alguno.

loans.use: Buying a vehicle for taxi use

loans.name: Alternativa 8 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala, just like the other members of the group, works as a local artisan creating tablecloths, seat cushions, and napkins which she knits with beautiful local designs. These are the local designs of the area. Pascuala also has a small business in her house in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. The rest of the ladies in the group sell their jewelry to the local stores and among tourists that visit the area.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

PASCUALA AL IGUAL QUE LA OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO TRABAJA COMO ARTESANA CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES , COJINES, SERVILLETAS Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA CON LOS DISEÑOS TIPICOS QUE CARACTERIZAN LOS BORDADOS DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE .ADEMAS PASCUALA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN SUS CASDA DONDE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD . EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO COMERCIALIZAN SUS PRENDAS ARTESANALES ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA

loans.use: Purchase of  knitting materials for wholesale and materials to make their own jewelry

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single and owns a family printing business in downtown Izyum. Alexander is very creative and full of ideas. He has had rich experiences working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. Alexander sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. He has now been in this business for the past three years. Presently, his monthly net profit is about $300.

Alexander would like to get a loan of $1200 to purchase some necessary printing equipment. He believes that financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work to make his entrepreneurial dreams a reality, understanding that real success and wealth takes time. Alexander is hoping to generate additional profits and organize his wedding which is coming up in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase printing equipment

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei started working as a taxi driver in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine about five years ago. He provides transportation services in the region around Ivano-Frankivsk or longer distances if required. He has been able to purchase a car using credit and is looking forward to paying it off. Andrei is married and supports his wife and seven year-old daughter with his taxi business.

Andrei has requested a loan of $300 to purchase a necessary taxi license and a fare counter for his car. This loan will help him equip his car properly and continue to operate a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase taxi license and counter

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna lives in Mukachevo where she helps take care of her sick mother. Ganna is a small entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothing in the local mall. The type of inventory for sale in her store is always in high demand and she has many loyal customers. She has been in this trade for 12 years. Currently, Ganna has about $1500 in inventory.

Ganna is a people person which is why it’s easy for her to build and maintain relationships with the circle of people around her and her business. Moreover, Ganna is a persistent hard-worker. She is very committed to her venture and invests much energy and effort in it. Presently, Ganna is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase assortment variety for her little store. She believes additional financing will help her venture expand and blossom into a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of home product inventory

loans.name: Victoria 3 Group

texts.es:
Juana is an artisan, she's 20 years old, married. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables. The rest of the women in the group are artisans. They are a big part of the group's economic wealth because tourists' come to this area to purchase beautiful fabrics/outfits of many vibrant colors.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA ES ARTESANA , TIENE 20 AÑOS , CASADA , SU ESPOSO VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS .EL RESTO DE LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN EL GRUPO TAMBIEN TRABAJAN EN ARTESANIAS YA QUE CONSTITUYE EL FUERTE DE INGRESO DE MUCHAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD PORQUE ESA ZONA ES MUY VISITADA POR LOS TURISTAS LOS CUALES COMPRAN SUS PRODUCTOS POR LA BELLEZA DE SUS BORDADOS Y COLORES VISTOSOS

loans.use: Will invest loan on silk threads for knitting and to purchase fabrics to increase their production

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor has a small medal working/blacksmith shop where he does metal work and creates a variety of quality metal products. Igor’s business is located at his home in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of western Ukraine. He has been in his quite successful business for about six years and now employs two other people. Igor has developed a reputation for fast service, making quality products for reasonable prices. He makes about $1400 profit in a normal month and has about $8000 invested in his business. Igor is married and has two kids - a daughter who is 20 and a son who is 11.

Igor has requested an eight month loan of $1200 to purchase material to use in his business. He has proven to be an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, paying off all previous loans in full and some even early. We are happy for the opportunity to continue helping this dedicated, hard-working entrepreneur operate a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for medal working trade

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has a small business selling grocery items at one of the busy markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Her business was initially started by Irina’s mother who passed it on to Irina and helped her get established on her own. This has been a good business for Irina to be in as there is always demand for food products. Irina is divorced and is raising a thirteen-year-old daughter.

Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to help open a new sales location that will be more comfortable and will hopefully lead to higher sales and profits. Irina has been a good loan client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy for this opportunity to help Irina improve her business and invest in its future.

loans.use: Open new sales location

loans.name: Faida Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rose A. O., 38, is married with two children. Her primary business activity is a nursery school and a home care center. She started off with less than 10 children in 1998 and has since expanded to 60 children. She says that her main reason for starting the nursery/baby care was because of her love for children and desire to see them grow and also for profit to take care of her family's needs.

Rose started off with a capital base of Ksh 5000/= and has gradually ploughed back profits into her business over the years to allow her to reach to where she currently is. Her main challenge is lack of capital to cater to the increasing children seeking admission. This deficit is mainly in the learning facilities and feeding programme for the children. She thus intends to use the loan capital for this purpose while also using the profits from the business to help in meeting her family's needs.

Rose is the Chairman of the group she belongs to and she hopes to use her leadership skills acquired while managing the school to similarly ensure that the group remains cohesive to enable her to benefit from other loans in future. She has so far exhibited these leadership skills in marshalling the group together during the training sessions. Her business is in area called Muhoroni, almost 80 kilometres away from Kisumu town. This is the first loan she is taking with the Faida self help group but the training records from the loan officer indicate good attendance and participation by the group during group training sessions.

loans.use: To expand learning facilities and feeding programme for her nursery school

loans.name: Laura 2 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala is married, has 3 children, and creates shawls, skirts, and napkins which she makes and then sells to the tourists that visit the city. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables to support the family. The other members of the group work as artisans making clothing and embroidered tablecloths which they sell to the tourists and in the San Cristobal artisan market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

PASCUALA , ESTA CASADA TIENE 3 HIJOS SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE CHALES , FALDAS , SERVILLETAS LAS CUALES CONFECCIONA Y POSTERIORMENTE VENDE ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD . SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS PARA APOYAR EL PRESUPUESTO FAMILIAR ..LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DESEMPEÑAN COMO ARTESANAS CONFECCIONANDO PRENDAS DE VESTIR Y MANTAS BORDADAS LAS CUALES TAMBIEN COMERCIALIZAN CON LOS TURISTAS DE LA ZONA Y EN LOS MERCADOS ARTESANALES DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL.

loans.use: They will purchase thread and materials at wholesale prices thereby reducing their costs in order to increase earnings

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with one child. He owns a small business in the town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Ivan works in the central market selling household chemicals and cosmetics. There is not a high amount of competition for Ivan’s business in the area where he works. A favorable location for his vending kiosk and financial assistance through Nadiya Ukraine are factors that have positively impacted the growth of his business.

Ivan likes to work in this sphere of trade. He has pushed ahead through the difficulties of marketplace rejection, wrong sale trends, bad timing and other vagaries that can afflict a start-up business. A combination of core commercial skills, enthusiasm and the determination to succeed have been his motivating factors. Ivan would like to get a loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory which he believes will help him not only sustain his business but also promote its significant growth.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur with a small business selling household products in the center of her little village near Nicopol, Ukraine. Lubov carries a broad assortment of products and offers convenient, quality service to her customers. She has no significant, direct competition from other vendors that helps to ensure good sales demand and a steady income. Lubov is married to her husband, Nicolai, and together have two children. One of Lubov’s goals for her business is to increase her family’s income.

Lubov has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase new inventory to sell. She has a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and we are glad for another opportunity to assist her with her business enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a widow. She lives in Mukachevo and works in the local trade center selling gifts and souvenirs. Magdalina started this venture 12 years ago. Her enthusiasm and commitment have added greatly to the success of her business. Currently, she has about $5000 in inventory.

Magdalina values each of her clients very much. She is very skilled at interacting in one-on-one conversations. The result of valuing personal relationships with her customers gives Magdalina’s business the biggest leg up against other clothing market entrepreneurs. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital, boost her sales and gain additional revenues.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya and her best friend operate a small clothing sales business at the “Pyatachok” market in Ivano-Frankivsk, a large city in western Ukraine. They sell an assortment of women’s and children’s clothing. Due to some reconstruction work at their market, they have been temporarily displaced to a new market nearby and will continue to sell there until the work is finished. Nadiya has had her business for five years. She is single and her business is her main means of support, providing about $400-$500 income for her each month.

Nadiya has requested a loan of $600 so she can purchase new inventory supplies. Nadiya hopes to continue developing her business and would like to open an additional sales kiosk in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lourdes 7 Group

texts.es:
Eloina is 52 years old, married with 6 children, her husband works as a plumber and she has a bakery in her home. Eliona, Along with three members of her group, Dolores, Silvia, and Minerva, work together and share the expenses. In addition some of the members sell the bread house to house to the neighbors in their community. Juana sells gasoline for stoves and vehicles, Guadalupe has a small hardware store in her home and Emilia has a candy store in the area school. Because of the diverse activities of the group each member will use the loan to support their respective businesses in order to increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ELOINA TIENE 52 AÑOS , CASADA CON 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO FONTANERO Y ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PANADERIA EN SOCIEDAD CON TRES INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO DOÑA DOLORES , DOÑA SILVIA Y DOÑA MINERVA ELLAS TRABAJAN EN CONJUNTO Y SE DISTRIBUYEN LOS GASTOS , ADEMAS QUE ALGUNAS DE ELLAS SALEN A VENDER EL PAN DE CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS VECINAS DE SU COMUNIDAD . JUANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GASOLINA PARA ESTUFAS Y VEHICULOS , GUADALUPE TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA FERRETERIA EN SU HOGAR Y EMILIA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE DULCES EN LA ESCUELA DEL SECTOR. POR LA DIVERSIDAD DE LAS ACTIVIDADES DEL GRUPO CADA CUAL HARÁ USO DE SU PRESTAMO APORTANDO A SUS NEGOCIOS RESPECTIVOS PARA INCREMENTAR LAS GANANCIAS

loans.use: Invest in kitchen utensils and merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a dedicated entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. She supports herself and her 16year old daughter with a small grocery sales business located at a busy market in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Rosa started her business about 10 years ago at the suggestion of a friend. With dedication and hard-work, her business has prospered and now provides a good income for Rosa and her daughter.

Rosa has requested a six-month loan of $1000 to purchase a new refrigerator unit for her kiosk. This loan will help her to continue offering good service and a variety of food items to her customers, increasing her sales and income as a result.

loans.use: To purchase a new fridge unit

loans.name: Adela Malvina

texts.es:
Adela is 41 years old, she completed first grade in elementary school, she has 6 children but only 2 depend on her. She lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, Libertad state.

Adela has various activities: she sells alfalfa and she has become well known because she is the only person in this area that sells this product. She also sells clothing, she buys the items in Lima according to her customers' orders and later sells the clothing to them on credit; she also braids reeds (dried) to make furniture.

She is a member of the "Mujeres Valerosas" Communal Bank, and it is from this bank she obtained her first load of 300 soles (approximately US$100) and with this money she purchased dried reeds. The current loan from Manuela Ramos for 500 soles (approximately US$167) will be repaid in 4 months; she will use it to travel to Lima and buy clothing, now that she has had various customer orders with the change in the seasons.

Adela dreams of opening a boutique in her home so that she doesn't have to travel house to house to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adela tiene 41 años de edad, estudió solo el primer grado de primaria, tiene 6 hijos pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad.

La señora Adela realiza varias actividades: vende alfalfa (yerba) y se ha hecho muy conocida porque es la única de esa zona que vende este producto, también vende ropa, compra en Lima según los pedidos de sus clientes y luego los vende a crédito; también trenza junco (planta seca) para confeccionar muebles.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $ 100) con este dinero compró junco. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.500.00 (aproximadamente $167) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses; lo utilizará para viajar a Lima y comprar ropa, ya que tuvo varios pedidos de sus clientes por el cambio de estación.

La señora Adela sueña con poner en su casa una boutique para que ya no tenga que salir a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Ms. Clotilde has her business in the "Bellavista" market, located in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo Province in the La Libertad area. She works selling spices (pepper, cumin, saffron). She also sells escabeche chili peppers, yellow chili peppers, cilantro, garlic, fruits and vegetables. She works in the market in the morning and in the afternoon she prepares desserts such as jello, flan and other typical pastries to sell them in her home. This way Ms. Clotilde can support her 4 children that still depend on her.

Previously she worked selling vegetable stew but after receiving her first loan from the Communal Bank she changed her plans since the stew business was not very profitable.

With the first loan received from the Communal Bank of Bellavista, of approximately $100, she bought all the necessary utensils to grind her spices and peppers.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of approximately $402 that had a 6 month payment period, she bought 1 unit of potatoes, vegetables and all the necessary for the spices she makes.

Ms. Clotilde, at 32 years old, has a goal: to have a bigger store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clotilde tiene su negocio en el mercado “Bellavista” ubicado en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de condimentos molidos (pimienta, cominos, azafrán), también vende ají escabeche, ají amarillo, culantro, ajos, verduras y frutas. En el mercado trabaja durante la mañana y por las tardes prepara postres como gelatina, flan y marcianos para venderlos en su domicilio, de esta manera la señora Clotilde mantiene a sus 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender menestras sancochadas pero después de recibir el primer préstamo en su Banco Comunal cambió de giro ya que el negocio de las menestras no era muy rentable. Con el primer préstamo recibido en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100), compró todos los utensilios necesarios para moler los condimentos y ajíes. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,200.00 (aproximadamente $402) para cancelarlos en 6 meses, compró 1 arroba de papa, verduras, y todo los ingredientes para los molidos que realiza. La señora Clotilde a sus 32 años de edad se ha planteado una meta: tener una gran tienda en su casa.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and other food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Lourdes 8 Group

texts.es:
Evangelina is 38 years old, married, with three children. Her husband works as a farmer and she has had a pharmacy for 5 years, as has another member of the group, Eluteria. They will buy medicinal supplies at the laboratories together which reduces the cost of the purchase for them. The both sell basic health and beauty products. Magdalena, on the other hand, has a bakery in her home and she sells to the neighbors in her community. All three hope to increase their income upon expanding the quantity of merchandise that they have in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

EVANGELINA , TIENE 38 AÑOS , CASADA CON TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AGRICULTOR Y ELLA TIENE UNA FARMACIA DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS AL IGUAL QUE LA OTRA MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO LLAMADA ELUTERIA . ELLAS COMPRARAN MEDICAMENTOS A LOS LABORATORIOS EN CONJUNTO LO QUE LES REBAJA EL COSTO DE COMPRA AMBAS VENDEN PRODUCTOS BASICOS DE SALUD Y COSMETOLOGIA .DOÑA MAGDALENA EN CAMBIO TIENE UNA PANADERIA EN SU CASA Y VENDE A LOS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD .TODAS ELLAS ESPERAN INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS AL AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE MERCADERIA QUE TIENEN EN SUS NEGOCIOS

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his inventry

loans.name: Lanza 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Luz has had a grocery store in her house for 5 years. She is 44 years old, has three children, and her husband is a farmer. The other members of the group are Carolina, who has a candy store in her mother's home; Flor, who sells fruits and vegetables in her house; and Alejandra, who sells butchered chickens. As their businesses are diverse they will share the loan and each woman will invest in purchasing merchandise for her respective business so that she will be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LUZ TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS , ELLA TIENE 44 AÑOS , TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TIENEN COMO ACTIVIDAD : DOÑA CAROLINA UNA DULCERIA EN LA CASA DE SU MAMA , DOÑA FLOR VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU CASA Y DOÑA ALEJANDRA VENDE POLLOS TROZADOS COMO SUS ACTIVIDADES SON VARIADAS ELLAS SE REPARTIRAN EL PRESTAMO Y CADA UNA INVERTIRA APORTANDO MERCADERIAS A SUS NEGOCIOS PARA PODER DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to better supply their businesses

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene is 53 years old; she completed her studies up to secondary school and has 7 children, only one of which depends on her. She has two stands in the Bellavista market located in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo. At one stand she sells food and at the other, shoes, slippers and sandals.

In order to get what she has today, Yrene has worked at different businesses. She started out selling sweets and gelatin deserts in the streets; later she devoted herself to selling pots and containers for plants, also in the streets, and at the same time sold clothing to people she knew. Little by little she saved enough money to rent a space and put up her first stand in the Bellavista market, where she sold food. With her first loan from the Bellavista communal bank, she bought some sandals to start up her second stand.

With another loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy plates, silverware, pots, etc., which she needs to prepare meals and to be able to better serve her customers.

Her greatest dream is to buy some property within the market where she currently works.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yrene tiene 53 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 7 hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Tiene dos puestos en el mercado “Bellavista” ubicado en el Distrito de La Esperanza, Provincia de Trujillo Departamento de La Libertad; en un puesto vende comida y en el otro vende zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias.

Para conseguir lo que ahora tiene la señora Yrene ha pasado por distintos negocios primero se inició vendiendo por las calles dulce de chiclayo, mazamorra y gelatina (postres), luego se dedicó a vender maceteros, también como ambulante, y en paralelo vendía ropa a algunos conocidos. Poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que pudo alquilar e implementar su primer puesto en el mercado Bellavista donde vende comida. Con el primer préstamo que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” compró sandalias para implementar su segundo puesto.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará platos, cubiertos, algunas ollas, etc., las mismas que le hacían falta para la preparación de comida y poder servir al público en mejores condiciones.

Su mayor anhelo es comprar un terreno dentro del mercado donde actualmente labora.

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen supplies (utensils).

loans.name: Edita Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Edita, 59 years of age, through her hard work has been able to obtain two stalls at the “Bellavista” market in the Esperanza district of the Trujillo province, Department La Libertad. In one she sells groceries and in the other she sells prepared food (stuffed potatoes, broths, breakfast, corn bread, etc.) The first loan that she obtained from the Community Bank “Bellavista” of USD $100, she used to establish her stall for groceries.

Mrs. Edita used to work in manufacturing; she worked in a factory making clothing. She was discharged because of her age.

She started her business selling groceries in small quantities. Slowly, saving her profits and with loans from her community bank she has been growing her business.

Using the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of USD $425, which is to be repaid in 6 month, she is improving her food stall, which is a little bit disorganized. She is also buying sugar, rice and oil.

Mrs. Edita dreams of having a well run and modern restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer

La señora Edita a sus 59 años de edad y con el esfuerzo que le ha puesto al trabajo ha logrado obtener 2 puestos en el mercado “Bellavista” en el distrito de la Esperanza provincia Trujillo departamento La Libertad. En uno vende abarrotes y en el otro vende comida (papa rellena, caldos, desayunos, cachangas, etc.). El primer prestamos que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) le sirvió para implementar su puesto de abarrotes.

La señora Edita antes se dedicaba a la manufactura, era obrera en una empresa de confección de ropa pero por su edad la despidieron.

Inició su negocio vendiendo abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades y poco a poco ahorrando lo que ganaba y con los préstamos de su banco comunal ha ido creciendo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,20 para cancelarlos en 6 meses, ha mejorando el puesto de comida ya que estaba un poco desarreglado y también ha comprado azúcar, arroz y aceite.

La señora Edita sueña con tener un restaurante moderno y bien implementado.

loans.use: Purchase of various food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is a very hard working and determined woman. At 61 years old she runs a very well stocked grocery store where she sells a little bit of everything; fruit, vegetables, candy, groceries, cakes, carbonated drinks and beer. She only finished primary school. She has four children, but only one of them is dependent on her.

Mrs. Teresa lives in the District La Esperanza of the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department. She was previously renting a space in the Union market in the city of Trujillo where she sold groceries and vegetables. Unfortunately there was a fire and she lost everything. In spite of that misfortune, Mrs. Teresa continued to move forward and started anew. At that time getting her first loan from the Community Bank “Bellavista”, sponsored by Manuela Ramos, was a great help. The USD $100 that she received, enabled her to buy a new counter and groceries that she would sell in her store. This way, little by little, she grew her business. Recently she has requested a loan from Manuela Ramos of USD $275 to be repaid in 6 months. This money she will use to buy a sack of sugar, cases of different types of oil, etc.

Mrs. Teresa dreams of having a large grocery store with a variety of products that she can offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, a sus 61 años D. edad tiene una bodega muy surtida en la que venD. D. todo: fruta, verduras, golosinas, abarrotes, pasteles, gaseosas y cerveza, solo estudió primaria completa y tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno depenD. D. ella

La señora Teresa vive en el Distrito D. La Esperanza D. la Provincia D. Trujillo del Departamento D. La Libertad. Anteriormente alquilaba un puesto en el mercado Unión D. la ciudad D. Trujillo donD. vendía abarrotes y verduras pero lamentablemente se incendió y lo perdió todo; a pesar D. esa desgracia la señora Teresa siguió adelante y pudo empezar D. nuevo, en ese momento le fue D. gran ayuda recibir su primer préstamo en el Banco Comunal “Bellavista” promovido por Manuela Ramos. Con los S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que recibió compró un mostrador y abarrotes para vender en su bodega y así poco a poco fue implementándola. Recientemente ha obtenido un préstamo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.800.00 (aproximadamente $268) para cancelarlos en 6 meses, con el cual comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, cajas D. diferentes tipos D. aceite, etc.

La señora Teresa sueña con tener una bodega muy granD. con variedad D. productos que ofrecer a su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries).

loans.name: Alternativa 1 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 38 years old, married, with 5 children. Together with her husband she grows flowers that she sells in San Cristobal and in the flower shops in Tuxtla Gutierrez, who always ask for their products. They hope to buy seeds, liquid fertilizer and insecticide, which will enable them to have a good crop. The other members of the group are artisans who create items such as shawls, napkins, table cloths, and blouses that they sell to the tourists that vist the area, and they are also street vendors to community members who live in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ROSA TIENE 38 AÑOS , CASADA CON CINCO HIJOS JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA COSECHA DE FLORES LAS CUALES COMERCIALIZAN EN SANCRISTOBAL Y EN LAS FLORERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA GUTIERREZ QUIENES SIEMPRE SOLICITAN SUS PRODUCTOS.ELLOS ESPERAN COMPRAR SEMILLAS , LIQUIDOS FERTILIZANTES E INSECTICIDAS QUE LES PERMITAN UNA BUENA COSECHA . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN A LA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS DE ARTESANIA TALES COMO , CHALES , SERVILLETAS, MANTELES, BLUSAS LAS CUALES VENDEN ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA Y ALGUNAS VIAJAN A SAN CRISTOBAL Y LAS COMERCIALIZAN EN LAS CALLES COMO VENDEDOR PUBLICOS ENTRE LOS HABITANTES DE LA ZONA

loans.use: They will buy material for their artisan work and flower fertilizer.

loans.name: Alternativa 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a 55 year old widow with three children. She has been an artisan for many years, making embroidered blouses and tablecloths that she sells to the women in her community and also to the tourists that visit their area. Other members of the group also are artisans because it is the best source of income that they have, as their communities are being frequently visited by tourists because of the recognition and attention they have received for their embroidery work. Pascuala however grows and sells flowers in the San Cristobal market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA ELENA , TIENE 55 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE ESTA VIUDA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS SE DEDICA DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS A LA ARTESANIA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS Y MANTAS BORDADAS LAS QUE VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TAMBIEN CON LOS TUIRISTAS QUE VISITAN SU ZONA .LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A LA ARTESANIA DEBIDO A QUE ES COMO LA MEJOR FUENTE DE INGRESOS QUE POSEEN PORQUE SUS COMUNIDADES ESTAN SIENDO MUY VISITADAS POR LOS TURISTAS DEBIDO AL RECONOCIMIENTO DE SUS BORDADOS EN EL EXTERIOR.PASCUALA EN CAMBIO SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO Y VENTA DE FLORES LAS CUALES SALE A VENDER EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL

loans.use: Purchase fabric, looms and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in paper goods, gifts, toys and beauty products

loans.name: Lagos 3 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is a artisan. Her entire family -parents, brothers and sisters, and children- is involved in this activity. They sell their products for wholesale or retail in Zincantan or Nachij. They also rent a stand in the city of Ocozocuautla and pay someone to attend to that business. Every 20 days she travels to where their stand is and brings more goods to sell. They make napkins, tablecloths, shawls, blouses and pillowcases. The rest of the members of the group also make embroidered clothing which they sell to tourists. Maria M. is the only one who devotes her time to the purchase of seed and cultivation of flowers, in particular, roses. She rents a stand in the city of Tuxtla where she sells her flowers and makes floral arrangements for different events.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA ES ARTESANA TODA SU FAMILIA DESDE SUS PADRES , HERMANOS E HIJOS SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDEN POR MAYOREO O MENUDEO EN ZINACANTAN O NACHIJ. TAMBIEN CUENTAN CON UN LOCAL QUE RENTAN EN LA CIUDAD DE OCOZOCUAUTLA Y LE PAGAN A UNA PERSONA PARA QUE ATIENDA EL NEGOCIO Y CADA 20 DIAS ELLA VIAJA LLEVANDO MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR EL LOCAL .HACEN SERVILLETAS , MANTELES , CHALES, BLUSAS Y COJINES.LAS DEMAS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO TAMBIEN TRABAJAN HACIENDO PRENDAS DE ARTESANIA QUE VENDEN CON LOS TURISTAS SOLAMENTE MARIA M. SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS Y CULTIVO DE FLORES EN ESPECIAL ROSAS, RENTA UN LOCAL EN LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA DONDE VENDE SUS FLORES Y HACE ARREGLOS FLORALES PARA EVENTOS .

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric, thread and materials for weaving, in order to reduce costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods in cash and receive discounts from her distributors

loans.name: Lanza 4 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is 34 and married with 2 children; her husband works in the fields. For the past 6 years, she has sold clothing from her house as well as on the streets. Flor de Maria also sells clothing both from home and on the streets. Julieta and Adregonia have put small grocery stores in their homes and supply products to persons in their communities. Gabriela is the only one of the group who sells soft drinks from home, to people in her neighborhood. Each of them, with their share of the loan, will replenish their business' supply of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

GLORIA TIENE 34 AÑOS , CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRABAJO DEL CAMPO, ELLA VENDE ROPA EN SU CASA Y ADEMAS SALE A VENDER EN LAS CALLES DE LA CIUDAD DESDE HACE COMO 6 AÑOS . AL IGUAL QUE DOÑA FLOR DE MARIA QUIEN TAMBIEN TIENE EN SU CASA VENTA DE ROPA . EN EL CASO DE JULIETA Y ADREGONIA ELLAS TIENEN EN SUS CASAS TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ABASTECEN DE PRODUCTOS A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD .SOLAMENTE GABRIELA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS DESDE SU CASA A LOS VECINOS DE SU SECTOR. TODAS ELLAS ABASTECERAN DE MAS MERCADERIA SUS LOCALES CON LA PARTE QUE LES CORRSPONDE DEL PRESTAMO.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply their respective businesses.

loans.name: Lanza 6 Group

texts.es:
Romelia is 33, married with 2 children, and her husband works in the fields. For the past 8 years, she has run a small mill from her home where she grinds cooked corn to make dough for tortillas, which she then sells in her local community. The other members of the group have a variety of activities. Sabina has been selling chicken parts for the past 3 years. Margarita, on the other hand, sells artisan breads from her home. Both Irma and Francisca have put small grocery stores in their homes where they sell rice, sugar, milk and milk products, sweets and non-perishable goods to people who live nearby. The income from their businesses help all of them to put food on their tables.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

ROMELIA TIENE 33 AÑOS , CASADA , 2 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL CAMPO .ELL. DESD. HACE 8 AÑOS TIENE EN SU CASA UN MOLINO DOND. REALIZA L. MOLIENDA D. MAIZ COCIDO Y L. MASA POSTERIORMENTE L. HACE TORTILL. L. QUE VEND. A LOS MIEMBROS D. SU COMUNIDAD LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES SABINA SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. POLLO TROZADO DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS , EN CAMBIO MARGARITA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA PEQUEÑA AMASANDURIA DOND. VEND. PAN ARTESANAL , IRMA Y FRANCISCA POR SU PARTE TIENEN UNA TIENDA D. ABARROTES EN SUS DOMICILIOS DOND. VENDEN: ARROZ, AZUCAR , LECHE Y SUS DERIVADOS, DULCES, ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES A LAS PERSONAS QUE HABITAN CERCA D. SU CASA. CON LOS INGRESOS D. SUS NEGOCIOS TODAS ELLAS AYUDAN A LLEVAR EL ALIMENTO A SUS HOGARES.

loans.use: Supplies and products for their businesses.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Ms. Aurora belongs to the Communal Bank of Las Esmeraldas. She lives in the El Encanto housing settlement on Aviacion Avenue in the Calleria district in the Ucayali area. She is 32 years old and is the mother of 3 young children. Her husband is a fisherman but his salary is not enough, so with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of $100 she decided to invest in selling fish.

Currently, she sells products in the Bellavista market near the city's stadium. She gets up at 4 in the morning to make breakfast and then she goes to the port to buy her fish and from there she sells them in her stall to clients.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of approximately $770, which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 15 kilos of doncella, 10 kilos of gamitada, 20 kilos of boquichico, 10 kilos of palometa and 5 kilos of bagre (all types of local fish), as well as 5 blocks of ice and that way she will be able to offer a wide variety of fish to her clients and her sales will increase.

Aurora is very happy for having obtained the aforementioned loan. Her business has grown and the well being of her family is established and due to this she is very thankful because things are going well for her up to now.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Aurora pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano El Encanto Av. Aviación S/N del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, su esposo es pescador, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza, es así que Socorro, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de pescado. En la actualidad ella vende sus productos en el mercado de la Bellavista, al costado del estadio de nuestra cuidad. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para hacer el desayuno y después irse al puerto para comprar sus pescados y de ahí a venderlos en su puesto a sus clientes. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 (US$ 770.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 15 kilos de doncella, 10 kilos de gamitada, 20 kilos de boquichico, 10 kilos de palometa y 5 kilos de bagre, además de 5 barras de hielo y así ofrecer una gama de variedad de pescados a sus clientes y su venta aumente. Aurora esta muy contenta por haber obtenido dicho préstamo, ya que su negocio crece y el bienestar de su familia se establece, y por eso esta muy agradecida porque hasta la fecha le esta yendo muy bien.

loans.use: Buying fish in bulk, other shellfish and ice.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Ms. Blanca belongs to the Communal Bank “Luchando Por Nosotras” (Fighting for Us), and lives in Jr.Union Mz. 182 Lt. 1, in the Yarina Çocha district of the Ucayali department. She is 42 years old and mother of two girls, who are her pride. Her husband is an independent worker, but his income is not enough to cover the household expenses. With the first loan of U$ 100, received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small food sales business. She presently has a restaurant located at her home. She gets up very early every day to prepare the delicious meals she sells to her many clients. With the recent loan of approximately U$ 435 received from Manuela Ramos and to be repaid in six months, she will buy 12 table cloths, 12 plates, 12 glasses, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, a gas tank, oil, vegetables, etc. Blanca is very proud of her accomplishments, as she started with very little and is now expanding her business, which makes her very happy and grateful to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr.Union Mz. 182 Lt. 1, del distrito Yarina Çocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre 2 hijas que son su orgullo. Su esposo realiza trabajos independientes, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Blanca, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, donde todos los días se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus comidas para venderlas a sus clientes, que son muchos ya que la sazón de Blanca es muy exquisita. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.300, (US$ 435.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 12 manteles, 12 platos, 12 vasos, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 1 balón de gas, aceite, menestras, etc. Blanca está muy orgullosa por todo lo que está logrando, porque empezó con poco y ahora ya esta ampliando su negocio y eso la hace muy feliz y agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos por los logros obtenidos.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and combustible.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old, the mother of 5 children who are grown but who always support everything she does. She was widowed many years ago. Thanks to the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she started a business buying and selling milk products.

Currently she has a stand where she sells fresh milk, cheese, manjar blanco (a milk-based dessert) and ingredients for preparing cheese. She also sells bread with cheese, hamburgers and warm milk. She gets up a 4 in the morning to sell her products at the No. 2 market in the city.

With another loan from Manuel Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of packaging to keep the milk fresh, and in fresh cow´s milk and cheese.

Carmen is content to have been working with Manuela Ramos during these 7 years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos ya independientes pero que siempre la apoyan en todo, enviudó hace muchos años. Gracias el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos puso un negocio de compra y venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto de venta de leche fresca, queso, manjar blanco, e insumos para la preparación de quesos, también vende pan con queso, hamburguesas, leche caliente, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para vender sus productos en el mercado Nº 2 de nuestra ciudad.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en compra de embaces para mantener fresca la leche y en leche fresca de vaca y queso.

Carmen está muy conforme en estos siete años que esta trabajado con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of packaging. Purchase of cow´s milk and cheese.

loans.name: Fredevinda

texts.es:
Fredevinda belongs to the Communal Bank of Virtuous Women. She lives in the district Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and is the mother of one son who is already independent, but who is always by her side. Her husband works in the manufacturing of footwear, but the income that he brings in is not enough for their household expenses. So, Fredevinda, with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $ 100.00USD, decided to invest in the sale of food.

They have now reached a position of selling meals in the number 2 market of the city. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. The typical foods she sells are "juanes, rice chaufa, anticuchos", etc. (food of the region). She rises at dawn to prepare breakfast for their customers, and then prepares lunches and dinners that sell in the afternoon and evening. With this recent loan requested from Manuela Ramos of S /. 1,500, (approx. $ 502.00 USD), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy two sacks of rice, 10 kilos of potatoes, four chickens, some fish, 1 sack of sugar, onions, tomatoes, bananas, etc.

Fredevinda is very happy to see that her business prospers, and says that it feels very good to work with Manuela Ramos. She tells us that these loans which are offered to women are a great support.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Fredevinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Jr.Luis Antunez de Manolo S/N, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad y es madre 1 hijo que ya es independiente pero que siempre esta a su lado, su esposo trabaja en la confección de calzados, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para sus gastos familiares, es así que Fredevinda, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad cuenta con una puesto de venta de comidas en el mercado Nro. 2 de la ciudad, en las mañanas vende desayunos, almuerzos, y por las noches vende afuera del mercado cenas, juanes, arroz chaufa, anticuchos, etc. (comida de la zona). Se levanta en la madrugada para preparar el desayuno de sus comensales (clientes) y después prepara los almuerzos y las cenas que venderá por la tarde y la noche. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 10 kl. de papas, 4 pollos, S/. 30 en pescado, 1 saco de azúcar, cebolla, tomate, plátano, etc. Fredevinda está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, se siente muy bien trabajando con Manuela Ramos, nos dijo que es un gran apoyo el préstamo que les brinda a las mujeres.

loans.use: Purchase of food products to supplement her business (two sacks of rice, 10 kilos of potatoes, four chickens, some fish, 1 sack of sugar, onions, tomatoes, bananas, etc.)

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Kelita belongs to the The Esmeraldas Communal Bank. She lives in the Human Settlement JJ. Munoz, the district Calleria, Ucayali department. She is 32 years of age, and is the mother of 2 children, who are still small and are dependent on her. Her husband is a car mechanic, but the income that he earns is not enough for the household expenses. So with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 300.00 ($ 100.00), Elizabeth decided to invest in the purchase of spare parts and accessories for cars..

She currently has a small post set up in her home and sells ladies', men's and children's clothing. Early in the mornings, she gets her children ready for school then goes out to sell clothing door to door. Then in the evenings, back at her home, she continues to sell clothing to customers who know good quality and good taste.

With this recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 1,200 ($ 402.00 approx.), which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy many items such as two dozen blouses, one dozen shirts and accessories for men, etc. Now that Christmas is approaching, she has many orders from her clients. Kelita is very happy to see that her business thrives because she feels this is a very important achievement for her. This has helped the welfare of her family and brought her economic stability which she had longed for, thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano JJ. Muñoz, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos que aun son pequeños y depende mucho de ella. Su esposo es mecánico de motocarros, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00(US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motocarros. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ubicado en su propia casa. Desde muy temprano alista a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y luego sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, y en las tardes atiende en su casa a sus clientes que saben del buen gusto que tiene para las prendas de vestir. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.200 (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará medio ciento de polos, dos docenas de blusas, 1 docena de camisas para caballeros y accesorios de vestir ahora que se acerca las fiestas navideñas, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientas. Kelita está muy contenta de ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, así alcanza el bienestar de su familia y la estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba y ahora tiene gracias Subscribe a Manuela Ramos. La señora Kelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano JJ. Muñoz, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos que aun son pequeños y depende mucho de ella. Su esposo es mecánico de motocarros, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00(US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motocarros. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ubicado en su propia casa. Desde muy temprano alista a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y luego sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, y en las tardes atiende en su casa a sus clientes que saben del buen gusto que tiene para las prendas de vestir. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.200 (US$ 402.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará medio ciento de polos, dos docenas de blusas, 1 docena de camisas para caballeros y accesorios de vestir ahora que se acerca las fiestas navideñas, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientas. Kelita está muy contenta de ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, así alcanza el bienestar de su familia y la estabilidad económica que tanto anhelaba y ahora tiene gracias a Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in her business.  (Compra de prendas de vestir (ropa).)

loans.name: Kely Aurora

texts.es:
Kely belongs to the "Fighting for Us Communal Bank". She lives in Jr. Union Mz. 180 Lt. 4, the district Yarina Çocha, Ucayali department. She is 44 years old, and is the mother three sons, and although two are independent, they depend on her. Her husband works in the sale of gravel and soil (for construction materials), but the income that he earns is not enough to cover the household expenses. So Kely, after receiving the first loan from Manuela Ramos of S /. 300.00 ($ 100.00), decided to invest in the business of recycling.

She currently runs her recycling business out of her own home, where she gets up very early each day to do her domestic chores, and then devotes attention to her business. Each day she receives large quantities of products for recycling and keeps very busy but without neglecting her family, which is the most important thing to her and is the reason she works to give them the best she can.

Now, with the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos of S /. 2,800, ($ 937.00 approx.), which will be paid in 6 months, she wishes to invest the money on the purchase of 4 tons of recycling and a portion on transporting the recycled to Lima.

Kely is very happy because her recycling business is growing and this thinking of opening up another branch of her business at another location, since the space of her house is becoming very small. Her family celebrates these achievements with great joy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kely pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr. Unión Mz. 180 Lt. 4, del distrito Yarina Çocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre 3 hijos, dos ya son independientes y una aun depende de ella. Su esposo trabaja en la venta de ripio y tierra (material para construcción), pero el ingreso que tienen no les alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Kely, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en el negocio del reciclaje. En la actualidad cuenta su negocio de reciclaje ubicado en su propia casa, donde todos los días se levanta muy temprano a hacer sus quehaceres domésticos, y luego se dedica a la atención de su negocio, porque todos los días recibe grandes cantidades de productos para reciclar y la mantiene muy ocupada pero sin descuidar a su familia que es lo mas importante y es por ellos que les da lo mejor que puede. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2.800, (US$ 937.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, podrá invertir S/. 1,500 en la compra de 4 toneladas de reciclaje y S/. 600 será utilizado para el pago de transporte a la ciudad de Lima. Kely está muy feliz porque su negocio de reciclaje está creciendo y esta pensando en abrir una sucursal en otro lado, porque el espacio de su casa ya le esta quedando muy chico. Su familia celebra sus logros con mucha alegría.

loans.use: To purchase bulk recyclables. (Compra de productos reciclados al por mayor.)

loans.name: Francis Dalia

texts.es:
Ms. Francis Dalia B. H. is originally from the city of Bluefields.  She is 46 years old and married to Carlos Gutiérrez.  Both have 2 daughters who are college students.  Ms. B. is the owner of a grocery store; she has 20 years of experience.  Her customers are family men/women who like to come to her store for the variety of products it offers.  Ms. B. needs to buy 1 freezer which costs $535.  This investment will also allow her to buy more dairy products and sausages to meet her customers' demands.

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. 

La Sra. Francis Dalia B. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Gutiérrez ambos tiene 2 hijas que estudian en la universidad. La Sra. B. es propietaria de una pulpería, tiene 20 años de experiencia,  sus clientes son los padres de familia  que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de productos. La Sra. B. necesita compra 1 freezer que le cuesta $535.00 dólares, con esta inversión podrá comprar más productos lácteos y embutidos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 44.58 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 44.58 dólares
La cuota real de pago es de $ 44.58 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 44.58 dólares

loans.name: Mileidy Rudesindo

texts.en:
Mileidy is a smart and untiring businesswoman.  She sells women’s clothing and beauty products.  Mileidy is thirty-four years, and she and her husband and an 11-year-old daughter.

She started that business almost two years ago in conjunction with her husband.  They have a lot of customers who visit their house to purchase products.  The entrepreneur says business is very profitable, and she wants to add new products to the ‘store’ so as to attract new clients.

With her loan, she will purchase bed spread sets, bed sheets, and curtains, as well as clothing in bulk to keep on satisfying her customers’ needs.  Mileidy hopes she can use a big local shop in a few years, where she can run the business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk and goods such as curtains and bed spreads, to enlarge a business.

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is an experienced entrepreneur that has been selling ice cream for two years.  She has five children, two of them boys that have their own families.  The girls live with Mom.

Camila trusts in the power of persistence and hard work.  She says that everyone who needs to have success must struggle.  She purchases ice cream outside her community and resells them within her house, or sometimes close to a public school.

Camila is requesting a loan to purchase more goods and a small freezer.  The one she used to keep the ice cream in is not hers but rented.  She thinks that’s a good investment and that before long she can significantly increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Loan will be invested in the purchase of a small freezer for entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is married with four children, three of them boys.  They don’t attend school.  Her husband works outside her community.

Rosa has always been an active woman.  When she is not working as housekeeper, you’ll see her selling anything just to support her children, since her husband's income is not enough to bear all the family's expenses.

Now, Rosa plans on doing business more reliably.  With her loan, she will purchase rice, beans, vegetable oil, bread and other foodstuffs to sell within her house.  Her general store’s name will be “D’ Rosa Colmado”.  Given the loan, Rosa will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy goods to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.en:
Lucía sells an assortment of tennis shoes for women in her community.  She started her business six years ago, with her husband’s help.  She has four children, three of them boys.  They all attend school.

Lucía plans on enlarging her business, in order to increase her income and attract more people.  She has requested a loan to purchase more tennis gear to satisfy her customers’ needs.  She will also buy some slippers to add to the merchandise.  That way, the entrepreneur will vary the offer and she hopes that strategy will help her attract new clients.  Profits from business help Lucía support her family.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will buy more tennis gear, and add new goods to her business.

loans.name: Estervina

texts.en:
Estervina, untiring and hardworking, runs a beauty salon within her house. She has a lot of experiences as entrepreneur since she has been doing that business for more than fifteen years. Estervina and her husband have four children, three of them girls. They all have finished secondary school.

Estervina´s beauty salon is well known in the community, and each two days she receives visits from a lot of customers that use her services.  Hair straightening and hair dying are some of her specialities.  Local women like to go to her salon because of her kindness and great abilities.

The entrepreneur envisions her beauty salon becoming very big salon with many more customers.  She also wants to hire a girl to help in the business so that she can run the salon six days a week.  The loan requested will help Estervina achieve that goals and will help hair maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy products that are running down in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Martina Heredia

texts.en:
Martina is thirty-eight years old, and she and her partner have four children who go to the university. Martina is a very active businesswoman who struggles to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her children. She says that since childhood, she has learned the price of persistence. Her parents used to force her to work to make a living.

Now, Martina runs a beauty salon that she started ten years ago. She offers services of hair dying, hair treatment, hairdos and so forth. She has a well-established clientele. She has a local salon where she operates the business. Martina plans on enlarging her salon and adding new services so that she can attract new clients.

With her loan, she will purchase goods that are running low in the salon, such as a hairdryer, rinse and shampoo. Martina says that goods are the raw materials with which she runs the business. The entrepreneur hopes her business can grow and she can make more profits in order to keep working for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Martina will use her loan to buy beauty products to keep operating her salon.

loans.name: Ngheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngheam Heng, 45, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Champ province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy growing crops and together earn around $1/day of profit. All of her children are currently employed at a garment factory and help to support the household by giving $100 each month between them.
In order to generate additional profits, Ngheam Heng and her husband would like to produce wine and sell them, yet they face a financial constraint in the business. Currently, this couple has requested for a loan to purchase some tools and other items to assist in their wine producing business. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs.Ngheam Heng is unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase tools and some items to produce Khmer wine.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho P., 56, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together in their farm growing rice crops and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory in the city and the rest are unemployed. Mrs. Tho P. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business. She believes this business will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business

loans.name: Adidiatu Ismaila

texts.en: A. is 47 years old. He is a butcher and owns a butcher shop in the Yopougon-Sideci market, in the north of Abidjan. He has owned this business since 1984 when he emigrated from Nigeria to Cote d'Ivoire. A. is married and has 3 children. He lives with his family in Yopougon. His wife sells cosmetic products in Adjame, another suburb of the city of Abidjan. A.'s children all go to school, and he cares for his family with the revenues from his business. A. heard about our microcredit program two years ago when he met a loan officer. He has benefited from different loans since then, and he repaid the loans successfully.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of cows

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
